Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to help drive informed business decisions. You will work closely with various departments to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights that support our company’s strategic goals.

Key Responsibilities Data Collection and Management : Gather, clean, and maintain large datasets from multiple sources. Data Analysis : Perform complex data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and provide actionable insights. Reporting and Visualization : Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively. Collaboration : Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and support projects. Continuous Improvement : Stay updated on industry trends and implement data-driven process improvements. Skills, Knowledge and Expertise Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role. Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel. Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and mathematical skills. Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a remote team environment. We specialize in delivering innovative solutions and exceptional services to meet the diverse needs of our clients. With a strong commitment to quality and customer satisfaction, we strive to exceed expectations and drive success in every project we undertake.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

Reporting to the VP of Platform Intelligence, the Data Analyst – Platform Intelligence is part of a cross-departmental discipline at Cint that provides insight on how our algorithms influence feasibility, delivery, and financial performance. These insights are used to improve our products to achieve financial targets and ensure our platform is optimized to deliver at full potential.

The incumbent will collaborate closely with Product and Technology stakeholders and will consult with Commercial, Operations and Finance teams to understand, explain, and predict how platform algorithms affect clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, nuanced, and predictive understanding of sample ecosystem dynamics (price elasticity, demand/supply clearing) and their underlying mechanics
With Cint’s Product Managers and engineers, enhance our products to confidently achieve predicted outcomes and optimize delivery
Provide advisory support to Product Development teams for subjects related to Platform Intelligence and/or insight driven product development
Create deliverables that express ecosystem dynamics simply and effectively to senior-level audiences, such as:
Visualizations of ecosystem metrics and trend analysis
Trend reports that track the impact and effectiveness of yield operations over time
Decision support documents for high-risk changes
Recommendations for development of Supply pipeline for commercial teams
Recommendations for development of Demand pipeline for commercial teams

Qualifications

What We Are Looking For:


Few years of working experience with pricing analytics and marketing or behavioral analytics
Previous experience with online market research methods/products is strongly preferred.
Explaining and defending analytical techniques in front of lay audiences
Experience with SQL and in working with large-scale databases
Experience with statistical computing languages like Python, R (statistical and data manipulation packages)
Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards using reporting or BI tool
Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner who is driven to deliver
Multiculturally competent
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to create data stories to drive product innovation
Ability to understand the big picture as well ensure the accuracy of details
Passionate about driving value using data and technology


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Grenergy es un productor independiente de energía (IPP) que integra el desarrollo, construcción, operación y mantenimiento de plantas de energía renovable a gran escala. La compañía incorpora además sus propios equipos dedicados a la originación de PPAs, financiación estructurada y M&A, generando eficiencias como consecuencia de la integración de todo el proceso.




A finales de 2019, dimos el salto a Mercado Continuo (Bolsa de Madrid), consolidando nuestro crecimiento y permitiéndonos continuar con nuestro ambicioso plan de expansión internacional. En la actualidad, contamos con presencia en 12 países: España (HQ), Chile, Colombia, Perú, México, Argentina, Italia, Alemania, Reino Unido, Polonia, Rumanía y Estados Unidos.




Grenergy ya cuenta con cerca de 1GW de proyectos en operación y construcción, y con un pipeline de 10GW de proyectos solares y eólicos en distintas etapas de desarrollo. Además, en 2021, la compañía ha invertido recursos para avanzar en el desarrollo de un pipeline adicional de casi 5GWh de proyectos de almacenamiento.




Debido a este crecimiento y a la fuerte apuesta de Grenergy, actualmente buscamos incorporar a un/a Data Analyst en nuestro equipo de Asset Management:




Cómo será tu día a día:




Desarrollar y mantener procesos de extracción de datos desde diferentes fuentes externas mediante el uso de APIs. Asegurar la integración y la calidad de los datos extraídos.
Gestión de Bases de Datos: Diseñar, implementar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y seguras. Asegurar la integridad, consistencia y disponibilidad de los datos.
Mejora permanente en las herramientas de reporting, incorporando las buenas prácticas presentes en el mercado.
Control y reporte del desempeño técnico-económico de activos fotovoltaicos y eólicos de la Compañía.
Colaboración interdepartamental: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros equipos
Técnicos y financieros para entender las necesidades de datos y proporcionar soluciones eficientes.




Requisitos de la posición:




Ingeniería informática, Industrial, ADE o similar.
Al menos 1 año de experiencia en un rol similar.
Deseable formación en Big Data y/o Data Science.
Deseable experiencia en el sector energético y/o productivo industrial.
Nivel de inglés B2.
Microsoft office avanzado: Excel, Power BI, Power Point.
Dominio de SQL o similar. Experiencia con herramientas y lenguajes de programación para la extracción y manipulación de datos (Python, Java, etc.).
Familiaridad con herramientas de integración y ETL.
Comprensión de principios de seguridad y privacidad de datos.
Herramientas de automatización de scripts (AirFlow, PowerAutomate, etc).
Conocimientos en cloud (Azure) y arquitectura.
Buenas habilidades comunicacionales, proactividad y trabajo en equipo.
Motivación y pasión por el desarrollo de las energías renovables.




Ofrecemos gran desarrollo profesional y estabilidad en un sector en auge, en una empresa cotizada en pleno crecimiento y expansión internacional, así como buen ambiente en un equipo joven y dinámico.




Grenergy se compromete a ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades laborales, sin discriminación, a todos los empleados y candidatos sin distinción de raza, sexo, edad, ascendencia, color, religión, discapacidad, estado civil, origen, identidad de género, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica.

En la actualidad, contamos con presencia en 12 países: España (HQ), Chile, Colombia, Perú, México, Argentina, Italia, Alemania, Reino Unido, Polonia, Rumanía y Estados Unidos.


Grenergy ya cuenta con cerca de 1GW de proyectos en operación y construcción, y con un pipeline de 10GW de proyectos solares y eólicos en distintas etapas de desarrollo. Además, en 2021, la compañía ha invertido recursos para avanzar en el desarrollo de un pipeline adicional de casi 5GWh de proyectos de almacenamiento.


Debido a este crecimiento y a la fuerte apuesta de Grenergy, actualmente buscamos incorporar a un/a Data Analyst en nuestro equipo de Asset Management:


Cómo será tu día a día:


  • Desarrollar y mantener procesos de extracción de datos desde diferentes fuentes externas mediante el uso de APIs. Asegurar la integración y la calidad de los datos extraídos.
  • Gestión de Bases de Datos: Diseñar, implementar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y seguras. Asegurar la integridad, consistencia y disponibilidad de los datos.
  • Mejora permanente en las herramientas de reporting, incorporando las buenas prácticas presentes en el mercado.
  • Control y reporte del desempeño técnico-económico de activos fotovoltaicos y eólicos de la Compañía.
  • Colaboración interdepartamental: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros equipos
  • Técnicos y financieros para entender las necesidades de datos y proporcionar soluciones eficientes.


Requisitos de la posición:


  • Ingeniería informática, Industrial, ADE o similar.
  • Al menos 1 año de experiencia en un rol similar.
  • Deseable formación en Big Data y/o Data Science.
  • Deseable experiencia en el sector energético y/o productivo industrial.
  • Nivel de inglés B2.
  • Microsoft office avanzado: Excel, Power BI, Power Point.
  • Dominio de SQL o similar. Experiencia con herramientas y lenguajes de programación para la extracción y manipulación de datos (Python, Java, etc.).
  • Familiaridad con herramientas de integración y ETL.
  • Comprensión de principios de seguridad y privacidad de datos.
  • Herramientas de automatización de scripts (AirFlow, PowerAutomate, etc).
  • Conocimientos en cloud (Azure) y arquitectura.
  • Buenas habilidades comunicacionales, proactividad y trabajo en equipo.
  • Motivación y pasión por el desarrollo de las energías renovables.


Ofrecemos gran desarrollo profesional y estabilidad en un sector en auge, en una empresa cotizada en pleno crecimiento y expansión internacional, así como buen ambiente en un equipo joven y dinámico.


Grenergy se compromete a ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades laborales, sin discriminación, a todos los empleados y candidatos sin distinción de raza, sexo, edad, ascendencia, color, religión, discapacidad, estado civil, origen, identidad de género, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
✨¿Quieres ser protagonista de soluciones que impacten a nivel global? ¡Forma parte del cambio!




💚 Somos Softtek, un grupo tecnológico global que integra una cultura única, beneficios y un gran desarrollo, tanto profesional como humano, con presencia en más de 20 países y 14 sedes en España. Generamos valor a través de la tecnología y nuestro objetivo es dejar huella y trascender en el ámbito de la transformación digital. Ya sumamos más 16.000 softtekians alrededor del mundo y seguimos creciendo.




En 2024 hemos sido reconocidos por la Lista Forbes como una de las 100 mejores empresas para trabajar en España, destacando por la flexibilidad y la personalización de la experiencia de nuestros colaboradores. Creemos que las personas con talento y autodeterminación son capaces de crear cosas asombrosas. ¿Nos acompañas en esta aventura? #FutureTogether




🔎¿Qué buscamos?




Estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst, con 4 años de experiencia, para formar parte de un equipo en un cliente del sector banca.

Tendrás la oportunidad de asumir interesantes desafíos y trabajar en proyectos de gran repercusión, utilizando tecnologías punteras y colaborando en equipos multidisciplinares en los que podrás aprender y aportar todo tu potencial.




Los requisitos más importantes son los siguientes:




Conocimientos y experiencia con manejo de sentencias SQL para extracción de datos desde Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL o MongoDB.
Experiencia en extracción de datos desde DataLakes vía Python, Spark o Scala
Conocimiento en Git y Github Actions
Nivel alto de idiomas: Portugués, español e inglés.




💻 ¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Entrarás a formar parte de un equipo agile que se encarga de la correcta definición del API, incluyendo properties, operaciones, definiciones de datos, así como el diseño para su implementación y la publicación en el API Manager.




✅¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido.

👪 Posibilidad de teletrabajo, horario flexible y mejoras para favorecer la conciliación a través de nuestro programa BetterWork.

✈️24 días de vacaciones

🩺 Seguro médico

Retribución flexible: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería o seguro médico familiares.

🎂 Tarde de cumpleaños libre (también por el cumple de tus hijos)

Club del empleado: ofertas y promociones exclusivas por ser Softtekian.

🎓 Planes de formación: idiomas, tecnologías y soft skills

🌍 Oportunidad de movilidad interna: contamos con presencia internacional y diversas sedes en España




Valoraremos especialmente la candidatura de personas que posean habilidades y capacidades únicas y diversas, reconociendo la importancia de facilitar su integración plena en el mercado laboral. Cada individuo, con sus capacidades singulares, aporta una riqueza invaluable a nuestra comunidad, y nuestro compromiso es asegurar que todos tengan la oportunidad de demostrar su valía y contribuir al crecimiento y la diversidad de nuestro equipo.




👀 ¿Todavía sigues aquí?

¡Tu incorporación es nuestra prioridad! No dudes en apuntarte, estamos deseando conocerte.

Title: Analista de datos Junior
Description:
Somos una multinacional canadiense especializada en consultoría tecnológica, con presencia en 21 sectores en más de 400 ubicaciones en todo el mundo, proveemos servicios de consultoría de negocio y de TI integrales, escalables y sostenibles que están analizados globalmente y entregados localmente.




Estamos buscando un/a Analista de Datos (junior) para impulsar nuestro equipo y realizar un trabajo de calidad del dato y realización de modelos de control para un cliente estratégico dentro de un gran proyecto.




Habilidades y Competencias Técnicas:

•Experiencia con Power BI

•Experiencia con SQL

•Experiencia con Python

•Conocimientos en el sector seguros




Grupo CGI ofrece:




-Contratación indefinida

-Horario flexible.

-Proyectos estable de larga duración.

-Pertenecer a un equipo de trabajo altamente cualificado en una empresa joven en proceso de expansión.

-Trabajar en un ambiente de trabajo amigable, donde la estrecha relación con los managers y con RRHH facilita el espíritu emprendedor, el intercambio de ideas, la iniciativa y el desarrollo de las personas.

-Formación en distintas tecnologías.

-Desarrollo profesional.




Si tienes capacidad de trabajo y ganas de seguir aprendiendo en una empresa dinámica y en constante crecimiento... ¡Esta es tu oportunidad!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Ruolo: Junior Data Analyst




📍 Località: Roma, zona Eur




🕒 Tipo di Contratto: tempo indeterminato, full-time




✨ Su di noi

Benvenutə in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.




🎯 La tua sfida

Sei curiosə di sapere quali sono i dati con i quali lavoriamo per tutelare i diversi repertori artistici? Sei neolaureatə e hai voglia di fare la differenza mettendoti in gioco? La sfida offerta da SIAE è quella di trasformare grandi quantità di dati in informazioni utili al supporto delle decisioni strategiche delle diverse funzioni aziendali.




💼 Le Tue Responsabilità

Analisi di dati: raccoglierai e organizzerai dati per migliorarne la qualità e l’affidabilità e identificherai modelli, tendenze e insights

Creazione di dashboard e report: comunicherai i risultati dell’analisi in modo chiaro ed efficace ai diversi team aziendali

Sviluppo e implementazione di modelli predittivi: utilizzerai algoritmi di machine learning e tecniche statistiche

Collaborazione con team interfunzionali: contribuirai al cambiamento aziendale integrando soluzioni analitiche nei processi e identificando opportunità di miglioramento




🎓 Requisiti

Formazione: laurea in discipline STEM

Lingue: buona conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata

Linguaggi di programmazione: Python, R, SQL, Qlik, Power BI, Tableau

Pacchetto Office: conoscenza eccellente di Excel e Power Point

Soft Skills: Eccellenti capacità comunicative, problem-solving e team working




🌈 Nice to have:

Esperienza lavorativa minima/ stage come data analyst

Passione per l’analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati

Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione

Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”




💰 Cosa Offriamo

Contributo Welfare Aziendale

Buoni Pasto da €6,5 al giorno

Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese

Premio di Risultato

Assistenza Sanitaria UniSalute

Contributo Previdenza Complementare

Borse di Studio per i figli

Abbonamento Annuale alla piattaforma linguistica Speexx

Servizio di VideoVisite 7 giorni su 7, dalle 9:00 alle 23:00

Supporto Psicologico e Nutrizionale




🌟 I nostri valori

Trust: conquistiamo la fiducia con sincerità e rispetto

Innovation: guardiamo al futuro proteggendo la nostra identità

Execution: crediamo in ciò che facciamo con responsabilità e passione

Entrepreneurship: siamo intraprendenti e valorizziamo iniziative e intuizioni




🚀 Unisciti a Noi: valutiamo tutte le candidature ricevute coerentemente con la cultura inclusiva e i valori che ci contraddistinguono ogni giorno, volti a valorizzare la diversità nelle sue molteplici forme come fondamentale contributo per la crescita aziendale e collettiva.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We have a new role for a Data Analyst with a leading institution based in Galway. This is a long-term role with an organisation that can provide a good salary. The role is initially onsite for the first 6 months but after this will move to a hybrid with 2-3 days working from home.




Primary Duties




Support the development and delivery of data and information services
Partner with senior stakeholders to provide dashboards which support decision making
Act as an SME on all data related activities within the function




Requirements




Experience within data analytics
Skills in any of the following including PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik etc
Excellent communication skills




On Offer




The client will provide a good salary of €55,000
The opportunity to work in a flexible working environment after 6 months’ probation
Excellent opportunities for personal and career development




Apply now by clicking the “Apply Now” button. Even if the job isn't quite right but you are looking for something similar, please get in touch




Why Apply Through Sigmar?




Gain access to exclusive roles that are not advertised elsewhere
We’ll help manage your job hunt, strengthen your interview skills and tidy up your CV
We’ll provide you with an overview of the jobs market within your industry and help you tailor your jobs search

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About InPost

InPost is a leading player in the business to consumer parcel delivery market. In Poland, they are successfully redesigning the last mile for e-commerce as the market leader.

InPost covers the Italian market with a network of 4300 PUDOs (Pick Up and Drop Off points) and 2222 fully automated parcel lockers (that are accessible 24/7) enabling customers to collect, send and return parcels at their earliest convenience. The aim is to continue scaling InPost in the Italian market in a similarly rapid trajectory to that of Integer’s Polish home market.

We’re passionate about our mission and products and our People are the reason we succeed.

We’re looking for people with drive and curiosity, who will join us in re-writing the norm!







*this is an Internship opportunity*




Who we're Looking for:




An excellent opportunity for talented candidates looking to join our Network Operations team. Lockers represent a small percentage of e-commerce deliveries in Italy today, but the desire for greater sustainability and more convenient solutions for consumers is creating a strong need for alternatives to traditional "home" deliveries. InPost is revolutionizing logistics services through a significant expansion of our automated locker network.







What You Will Be Doing

Analysis of operational and process KPIs
Maintenance of Team’s tools
Optimization of existing analysis models and preparation of new monitoring tools
Project management of strategic or operational activities identified through analysis, aimed at increasing business volume and profitability
Monitoring of project results and implementation of any corrective measures
Support for various operational departments in developing data-driven strategies
Support for various operational departments in tool maintenance







Skills

Intermediate level Excel
MUST HAVE: italian language
Basic level PowerPoint
Basic Knowledge different tools (i.e. Pipedrive, Jira)
Analytical mindset
Data-driven approach
Teamwork skills







Why Choosing InPost?

850€ scolarship
Excellent growth opportunities
Multinational environment
Flexible, creative, vibrant working environment
Contribute to the creation of responsible and sustainable logistics
Join a team of passionate, skilled, and motivated individuals




Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03

Invitiamo a prendere visione della nostra liberatoria privacy sul nostro sito www.inpost.it, alla sezione Privacy Policy - Colloqui e selezione.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, Dax and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Show more
HTML:
We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.


LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
  • Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
  • Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have an analytical mindset.
  • You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
  • You know all about the programming languages SQL, Dax and Python.
  • You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
  • You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.


You get even more bonus points if …

  • You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
  • You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
  • You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER

  • We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
  • Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst Junior
Description:
Unlimitail is a joint venture between Carrefour Group and Publicis Group, intending to become the leader of the retail media market in Europe and Latin America. It combines the power of Carrefour Links' in-store and e-commerce assets and traffic with Publicis Citrus Ad and Epsilon's on-site and off-site retail media technologies. The goal of Unlimitail is to become the premier retail media player in Continental Europe and South America for both in-store and digital channels.




Missions

Within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail’s analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.




As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.

You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries and on a wide variety of topics:




- Perform e-commerce campaigns analysis to provide detailed insights

- Conduct end-to-end ad hoc analysis to help retailers best monetize their inventory

- Participate in the design and maintenance of databases, using SQL to store and manage data efficiently

- Work on automating data analysis and data visualization capabilities

- Work on Unlimitail’s customer lifetime value calculation capability

- Participate in the development of new, cutting-edge abilities to create the best




Requirements:

· Master's degree in Data Analysis, business analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.

· Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction.

· Programming Languages: Python and SQL are mandatory. Any other is a plus

· Data Visualization: previous experience in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Power BI or Looker is a big plus

· Knowledge of GCP or Azure environment is a plus

· Problem-solving: Adept at approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions.

· Good communication skills in English. Another language (Spanish, Portuguese) is a plus.

· Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively




Benefits:

· 2 days of WFH

· 90% reimbursement of public transportation fees

· Office located in central Paris (Chatelet)

· Swile card of 10€/working days

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In a fast-changing and uncertain world, the right insights make the difference between seizing an opportunity and missing it entirely. Kline Energy helps energy and mobility clients across the world win in the market through timely advisory services following an agile, client-first organization. Our client base includes global energy companies and regional energy players, you will be able to influence the decisions of the key companies in the Energy industry




Kline recognizes the power of knowledge to anticipate change, unlock value and drive growth.

As a Data Analyst, you will combine strong analytical skills and a strategic mindset with real-world perspectives driven by an understanding of client issues and broader marketplace drivers. You will be working on projects related to different markets, countries globally and will interact with colleagues located in different countries. An Analyst's primary responsibility will be to analyze global markets, develop competitive and technical information, and build solid analysis and insights for client engagements.




Job Description:

As an integral part of the global project team within Kline’s Energy Practice, a Data Analyst will be expected to utilize the best-suited tools to research key markets and develop strategic recommendations for global clients, including:

Use data analytics to enhance clients’ understanding of key business, risk, strategic, or regulatory issues;
Manipulate and analyze large volumes of disparate data to develop critical insights for our clients’ issues, or business decision-making
Build statistical and machine learning models, or custom visualizations and applications, to detect patterns, trends, outliers and drivers among relevant business issues;
Apply predictive analytics, statistical modelling for both internal and external clients.
Assist with the collection, loading, standardization, and identification of relevant data for analysis;
Communicate findings from your analyses to your team members through visuals, data tables and models, and assist with the development of final deliverables, reports, and presentations to be distributed to clients;
Work closely with business stakeholders and experts in order to develop new and innovative tools to support the evolving data landscape, and stay up to date with developments in data analytics, solution architecture and programming languages;
This is NOT a technical IT role.







Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (preferred) with an academic focus on quantitative research (Computer Science and Engineering, Data Analytics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Management Information Systems, or Security Information Systems or related).
In addition, at least 4-6 years of pertinent industry experience in consulting, market research and/or competitive intelligence, or strategic marketing is ideal, with excellent analytical, modelling, strong communication and presentation skills is essential.
Candidates should have strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills, combined with outstanding business acumen.
Experience in data visualization using Excel, Power BI, Tableau
This position is currently home-office/remote-based. Kline & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package in a supportive work environment.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Availability to travel Middle East (25% of the time/Year)*




Who are we:




Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our largest international partners in the Telecommunications sector. It is one of the biggest references in the area, with a significant presence in more than 6 countries.




What you will do:




Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.




As a part of your job, you will:

Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.




What you are like:




Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.




Why join us:




• Work on challenging projects for big clients

• Learn more about emerging technologies

• Possibility of working remotely

• Design your career plan

• Access to continuous training and certifications

• Evolve through our internal mobility program

• … and much more!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 𝐚̀ 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?




💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?







Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client.




Quelle est ta contribution en tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre DATA 🌟 ?




En tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre Data, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective, au même titre que tous les membres du Chapitre.




Intégrant une communauté dynamique et experte de plus de 30 collaborateurs, tu auras un impact direct et mesurable sur les services autour de la Data destinés à nos Pôles Produits IT et nos collaborateurs en Caisses régionales.




En tant que spécialiste du traitement de la donnée, tu seras amené à extraire et exploiter les données métiers exposées, les restituer sous forme de Tableaux de Bords et d’en mener des analyses en lien fort avec les métiers concernés. Tu chercheras constamment à faciliter la prise de décision des métiers via la data ; véritable levier de création de valeur métier.




𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :







🚀 Participer à des projets excitants en couvrant des cas d’usages Data variés :




Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de cas d’usages Data sur des domaines et des enjeux métiers variés




Collaborer en transverse avec différentes Squads et ainsi des acteurs multiples




Echanger et améliorer les pratiques de Fabrication avec les autres membres du Chapitre du site de Lyon mais aussi ceux des autres sites France




🔍 D’apporter ton expertise d’analyse de la donnée pour répondre à des besoins métiers à forts enjeux bancaires :




En collaborant étroitement avec les Business Analystes afin d’identifier les besoins Data du métier grâce à des ateliers d’affinage




En collectant et exploitant les données pour les restituer sous forme d’indicateurs ou de Tableaux de bord, et ainsi contribuer et conduire les analyses Data mises en lien avec les problématiques métiers




En présentant les résultats aux équipes métiers




En étant un véritable référent et ambassadeur de la Data sur des sujets transverses




En véhiculant auprès des métiers le cadre de gouvernance Data (Data Management, Data Privacy…) de l’entreprise, en portant les messages et expertises autour du Digital




En contribuant à l’évolution des pratiques du Chapitre dans une logique d’amélioration continue




💻 D’utiliser et d’améliorer au quotidien nos outils et nos process d’analyses :




Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord via Microstrategy (sur des activités BI)




Calcul d’indicateurs via script SQL sur environnement Teradata (sur des activités BI) et intégration dans des pipelines de restitution normées




Mise en œuvre du Tracking sur les parcours utilisateurs et Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord pour restituer les données aux métier (sur des activités Parcours Digitaux) - Logiciel et solutions analytiques : Tag Commander, Piano Analytics, Cosmo Survey




Conduite des analyses marketing sur la base du tracking déployé et force de proposition sur les possibles optimisations lors de ces analyses.




Ta vie au sein de notre Equipe :




✅ Un environnement de travail axé sur la qualité et l’intelligence collective.




🌟 L’opportunité de favoriser le quotidien de nos conseillers en agence et la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.




👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour vous aider à maximiser votre potentiel




🧠 Des sessions collaboratives de brainstorming et de résolution de problèmes pour favoriser l'innovation




💬 Un accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques




🌟 Participer activement aux activités "d’innovation" via des ateliers d’idéation technique et par la mise en place de nouvelles pratiques agiles.




🧠 Nourrir ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement qui encourage la croissance professionnelle.







Découvrez le site de Lyon







𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :




Nous te proposons :




🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.




👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…




👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)




🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)




👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)




🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication




🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)




⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).













𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :




💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.




🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.




👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.




🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.




💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.




💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...







𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?




- Un premier échange avec ta Talent acquisition Spécialiste Mélissa- 1h

- Un test technique + un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un dernier échange avec Marieke ta future Leader ! - 1h




« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

HTML:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 𝐚̀ 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?


💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?



Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client.


Quelle est ta contribution en tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre DATA 🌟 ?


En tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre Data, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective, au même titre que tous les membres du Chapitre.


Intégrant une communauté dynamique et experte de plus de 30 collaborateurs, tu auras un impact direct et mesurable sur les services autour de la Data destinés à nos Pôles Produits IT et nos collaborateurs en Caisses régionales.


En tant que spécialiste du traitement de la donnée, tu seras amené à extraire et exploiter les données métiers exposées, les restituer sous forme de Tableaux de Bords et d’en mener des analyses en lien fort avec les métiers concernés. Tu chercheras constamment à faciliter la prise de décision des métiers via la data ; véritable levier de création de valeur métier.


𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :



🚀 Participer à des projets excitants en couvrant des cas d’usages Data variés :


  • Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de cas d’usages Data sur des domaines et des enjeux métiers variés


  • Collaborer en transverse avec différentes Squads et ainsi des acteurs multiples


  • Echanger et améliorer les pratiques de Fabrication avec les autres membres du Chapitre du site de Lyon mais aussi ceux des autres sites France


🔍 D’apporter ton expertise d’analyse de la donnée pour répondre à des besoins métiers à forts enjeux bancaires :


En collaborant étroitement avec les Business Analystes afin d’identifier les besoins Data du métier grâce à des ateliers d’affinage


En collectant et exploitant les données pour les restituer sous forme d’indicateurs ou de Tableaux de bord, et ainsi contribuer et conduire les analyses Data mises en lien avec les problématiques métiers


En présentant les résultats aux équipes métiers


En étant un véritable référent et ambassadeur de la Data sur des sujets transverses


En véhiculant auprès des métiers le cadre de gouvernance Data (Data Management, Data Privacy…) de l’entreprise, en portant les messages et expertises autour du Digital


En contribuant à l’évolution des pratiques du Chapitre dans une logique d’amélioration continue


💻 D’utiliser et d’améliorer au quotidien nos outils et nos process d’analyses :


  • Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord via Microstrategy (sur des activités BI)


  • Calcul d’indicateurs via script SQL sur environnement Teradata (sur des activités BI) et intégration dans des pipelines de restitution normées


  • Mise en œuvre du Tracking sur les parcours utilisateurs et Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord pour restituer les données aux métier (sur des activités Parcours Digitaux) - Logiciel et solutions analytiques : Tag Commander, Piano Analytics, Cosmo Survey


  • Conduite des analyses marketing sur la base du tracking déployé et force de proposition sur les possibles optimisations lors de ces analyses.


Ta vie au sein de notre Equipe :


✅ Un environnement de travail axé sur la qualité et l’intelligence collective.


🌟 L’opportunité de favoriser le quotidien de nos conseillers en agence et la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.


👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour vous aider à maximiser votre potentiel


🧠 Des sessions collaboratives de brainstorming et de résolution de problèmes pour favoriser l'innovation


💬 Un accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques


🌟 Participer activement aux activités "d’innovation" via des ateliers d’idéation technique et par la mise en place de nouvelles pratiques agiles.


🧠 Nourrir ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement qui encourage la croissance professionnelle.



Découvrez le site de Lyon



𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :


Nous te proposons :


🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.


👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…


👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)


🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)


👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)


🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication


🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)


⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).





𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :


💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.


🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.


👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.


🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.


💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.


💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...



𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?


- Un premier échange avec ta Talent acquisition Spécialiste Mélissa- 1h

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Producteur indépendant d’hydrocarbures, Perenco opère à toutes les étapes du cycle de vie des projets, de l’exploration au démantèlement.

Chaque jour, nous sommes confrontés aux défis de la création d’un avenir énergétique plus durable. Animés par l’audace et l’innovation, nous plaçons la performance au service du développement.

Chez Perenco, au-delà de vos compétences, nous accordons une grande importance à votre personnalité. A nos côtés, vous aurez l’opportunité d’affirmer votre potentiel et de vous créer un parcours professionnel unique et riche en expériences.




Description du poste:

Nous recherchons un Data analyst pour rejoindre notre équipe au sein de la Direction audit et performance opérationnelle et contribuer à la conception et à la maintenance de nos applications métiers. Le candidat retenu travaillera en étroite collaboration avec nos équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins et concevoir des solutions pour répondre à leurs besoins. Vous mettrez en œuvre des tableaux de bord de suivi des performances et des indicateurs de performance clés, et faciliterez l'accès aux informations grâce à des outils de reporting et d'analyse.




Responsabilités principales:

Concevoir et maintenir les rapports PowerBI de la société,
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et concevoir des solutions pour répondre à ces besoins,
Collaborer avec les équipes Data de la DSI pour développer des interfaces, des API, de nouveaux référenciels data afin de faciliter la mise en production de nouveaux outils digitaux,
Participer avec les data Owners et l’équipe Data à la définition des produits de données pour l’ensemble du Groupe,
Utiliser Snowflake et dbt pour concevoir des produits de données pertinents pour les besoins du services ou d’autres départements,
Créer des tableaux de bord PowerBI interactifs et des visualisations pour communiquer des insights aux équipes métiers,
Assurer la qualité et la précision des données utilisées dans les rapports et les applications,
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de la DSI pour s'assurer que les solutions proposées sont conformes aux normes de sécurité et de confidentialité de l'entreprise.

Notre Stack :

Data architecture : Snowflake et dbt,
Reporting : écosystème PowerBi,
Bonne connaissance des technologies SQL et noSQL,
Langage de développement : Python.




Qualifications requises:

Anglais courant, espagnol apprécié,
Stage de fin d'études en informatique, statistiques ou domaine connexe,
Maîtrise de Python et SQL pour extraire et manipuler des données,
Compétences en analyse de données et en visualisation pour communiquer efficacement des insights aux équipes métiers,
Excellentes compétences en communication pour travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers et DSI,
Capacité à travailler de manière autonome, vos prises d'initiatives sont fortement encouragées.




Soft skills :

Forte adaptabilité, capable d’évoluer dans un contexte agile et exigeant,
Rigueur, esprit d'analyse et de synthèse,
Bon relationnel et esprit d'équipe,
Force de proposition pour optimiser l’existant.

Show more

  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de la DSI pour s'assurer que les solutions proposées sont conformes aux normes de sécurité et de confidentialité de l'entreprise.

Notre Stack :

  • Data architecture : Snowflake et dbt,
  • Reporting : écosystème PowerBi,
  • Bonne connaissance des technologies SQL et noSQL,
  • Langage de développement : Python.


Qualifications requises:

  • Anglais courant, espagnol apprécié,
  • Stage de fin d'études en informatique, statistiques ou domaine connexe,
  • Maîtrise de Python et SQL pour extraire et manipuler des données,
  • Compétences en analyse de données et en visualisation pour communiquer efficacement des insights aux équipes métiers,
  • Excellentes compétences en communication pour travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers et DSI,
  • Capacité à travailler de manière autonome, vos prises d'initiatives sont fortement encouragées.


Soft skills :

  • Forte adaptabilité, capable d’évoluer dans un contexte agile et exigeant,
  • Rigueur, esprit d'analyse et de synthèse,
  • Bon relationnel et esprit d'équipe,
  • Force de proposition pour optimiser l’existant.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for an inquisitive and dedicated entry-level Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Does the idea of working with a large set of information and complex data, using innovative analysis techniques in order to achieve the best solutions for different businesses and for leading global brands in the market attract you?

We are aiming to recruit a recent graduate who’d like to join us as a Junior Data Analyst at our Advanced Analytics Centre of Excellence (CoE) team in Lisbon – with the opportunity to rapidly increase their expertise in the field of Data Science and Analytics, working and learning from a group of analysts and with some of the most powerful analysis tools and techniques that can be used to understand today’s data.

Using information from market-leading consumer panels and advanced data analysis techniques, you will support our customers’ needs and answer their toughest marketing-related questions with data insights and support their business growth.

You’ll be working with a team of like-minded Data Analysts within our Lisbon hub, carrying out data modelling processes for projects sold by our Expert Solutions teams around the world – you’ll work with a variety of different analytical techniques, datasets and brands to help answer a range of research and marketing questions from “How well did my advertising campaign perform?” to “Which products does my brand compete with?”.

At Worldpanel by Kantar, we are also currently embarking on a major shift in how we deliver analysis to our clients, with a new, best-in-class online platform (MyWorldPanel) through which we will deliver a suite of predictive analytics. This major development will not only step-change our client’s experience of using our data – you’ll also be involved in the transition of our analytics processes to this new cloud-based environment, helping to drive the quality, scale and efficiency of our solutions forward.

If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Work with Kantar Worldpanel local commercial teams to deliver analytical outputs for projects which will help our clients (brand owners and retailers) to better understand their markets and consumers.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data to help answer our clients’ business questions.
Work on the development of new skills, new analytical approaches and new ways of representing insight.
Work closely with other branches within the Centre of Excellence to support the development and improvement of advanced analytical techniques and the migration to a cloud-based platform.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Econometrics or equivalent quantitative fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum required).
Proven knowledge of SQL and R-Studio is mandatory.
Proven Knowledge/experience in SAS (Enterprise Guide) and Python although not required will be appreciated.


With the following qualities…


Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work optimally within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to connect with partners at all levels across the organization comfortably and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with TA.
3rd Stage – Final Meeting with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

Title: Data analysis stage
Description:
Ewiva ha l’obiettivo di costruire una rete di oltre 3.000 punti di ricarica ultra-veloci, ad alta potenza (fino a 350 kW) distribuiti in tutta Italia consentendo quindi di ricaricare su tutto il territorio nazionale, in qualsiasi momento, e ripartire in pochi minuti.




Il futuro sostenibile è oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralità climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.




Ewiva è una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilità elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.




Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.

Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuperà di:

Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management
Supporto nell'impostazione e nell'aggiornamento delle dashboard KPI in Microsoft PowerBI
Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management




Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
Capacità di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
Orientamento al cliente
Capacità di sviluppare presentazioni




Quali conosce ed esperienze vorremmo che avessi maturato in passato?

Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
Prima esperienza con Salesforce
Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
Inglese e italiano fluenti
Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia




Cosa aspetti a candidarti? Non vediamo l'ora di conoscerti!




Prima di inviare la tua candidatura, ti preghiamo di prendere visione dell’informativa privacy disponibile al seguente link: https://ewiva.com/privacy-policy-area-lavora-con-noi/.




Cosa ti offriamo?

Lo stage avrà una durata di 6 mesi.

Sarà previsto un rimborso mensile, rimborso dei pasti e la possibilità di lavorare in smart working.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Python & Power BI)
Description:
📢 🔎 Desde ACCOM, empresa de Marketing Digital orientada en ventas, buscamos nuevo/a compi como en el Equipo de Data & BI, como Data Engineer, con manejo de Power BI y conocimiento en Python!




💡 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Dominio en manejo de herramientas de visualización (PowerBI).
Conocimientos en SQL avanzado, desarrollo, gestión y rendimiento.
Experiencia en infraestructura de Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Conocimiento en Python.
Habilidades en analítica de datos orientado a resultados de negocio.
Grado en Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería Informática o similares.




📝 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos y visualizaciones efectivas.
Diseñar, crear y mantener flujos, informes y paneles de Power BI
Proporcionar soporte y capacitación en el uso de Power BI a los usuarios, ayudándoles a aprovechar al máximo la herramienta.
Analizar y optimizar el rendimiento de consultas SQL.
Trabajar en mapeo de datos, flujo de datos y linaje de datos.
Realizar análisis y evaluaciones de datos para identificar áreas de mejora, oportunidades de crecimiento y eficiencias operativas.




📌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Accom es una empresa de carácter joven y competitivo en constante crecimiento. Cuidamos mucho nuestra política de Talento y Cultura, buscando siempre la máxima vinculación de las personas con la empresa. Simplemente tratamos a las personas como nos gustaría que nos tratasen.




📈 Participación en la toma de decisiones.
📅 Flexibilidad horaria.
💻 Posibilidad de teletrabajo en formato híbrido (50%).
💳 Retribución flexible (seguro médico privado, restaurante, transporte y guardería).
📚 Plan formativo acorde a tus necesidades.
💼 Cursos de idiomas ajustados a tu nivel.
🍰 El día de tu cumpleaños libre.
🤼 Eventos y actividades internas para hacer team building.
🏋🏻‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios.
📍 Ubicaciones céntricas en Madrid (Callao).




¡Si crees que eres el perfil que buscamos, estaremos encantados de conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analytics Engineer

Skills: Data Analysis, Power BI, ETL/ Visualization/Monitoring

Location: Madrid Spain

Type: Permanent




We are at Coforge hiring for Data Analysis with Power BI, ETL/ Visualization/Monitoring




Description:

We are seeking for a technical person to be part of our Data & analytic team in one of our main customers in Spain.
This person will be part of an existing team in charge of the data collection, analysis, visualization and monitoring for one of the main business areas of this customer.
The position would require interacting with multiple stakeholders to pick-up requirements and create ad-hoc dashboards, automate existing reporting elements, dig into information to improve analysis and data visualization, etc.




Responsibilities

Design and delivery of business and operations dashboards.
Data analysis. Impact analysis of incidents.
Monitoring on data quality.
Deliver models to elaborate business targets.




Required some technical capabilities and development experience on:

Tools for BI/Visualization/Monitoring of data on Power BI and Splunk.
Database tools: SQL, Redshift.
Coding in Python is highly desirable and would be a very nice to have element User-level knowledge on Atlassian tools (Confluence & JIRA).




Certifications:

Any certification on any of the technical tools will be highly valuated and will be considered a differentiator against other candidates.




Prior Experience:

At least 2 to 4 years of experience in similar role.
Proven experience in the involved technology.
Show more
HTML:
Role: Data Analytics Engineer

Skills: Data Analysis, Power BI, ETL/ Visualization/Monitoring

Location: Madrid Spain

Type: Permanent


We are at Coforge hiring for Data Analysis with Power BI, ETL/ Visualization/Monitoring


Description:

  • We are seeking for a technical person to be part of our Data & analytic team in one of our main customers in Spain.
  • This person will be part of an existing team in charge of the data collection, analysis, visualization and monitoring for one of the main business areas of this customer.
  • The position would require interacting with multiple stakeholders to pick-up requirements and create ad-hoc dashboards, automate existing reporting elements, dig into information to improve analysis and data visualization, etc.


Responsibilities

  • Design and delivery of business and operations dashboards.
  • Data analysis. Impact analysis of incidents.
  • Monitoring on data quality.
  • Deliver models to elaborate business targets.


Required some technical capabilities and development experience on:

  • Tools for BI/Visualization/Monitoring of data on Power BI and Splunk.
  • Database tools: SQL, Redshift.
  • Coding in Python is highly desirable and would be a very nice to have element User-level knowledge on Atlassian tools (Confluence & JIRA).


Certifications:

  • Any certification on any of the technical tools will be highly valuated and will be considered a differentiator against other candidates.


Prior Experience:

  • At least 2 to 4 years of experience in similar role.
  • Proven experience in the involved technology.

Title: Business Data Analyst - Madrid
Description:
Engel & Völkers lleva más de 40 años en la intermediación de inmuebles residenciales y comerciales de alto standing, contando con unas 800 oficinas en 33 países y en 4 continentes. En España, tenemos una fuerte presencia desde el año 1990 y contamos en la actualidad con más de 80 tiendas.




En el Market Center de Madrid estamos buscando un Business Data Analyst, orientado a apoyar al equipo de operaciones para el crecimiento continuo de Engel & Völkers.




¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?




Construir soluciones pragmáticas, escalables y estadísticamente rigurosas para los problemas y desafíos que podamos enfrentar, aprovechando o desarrollando metodologías estadísticas y de aprendizaje automático.
Responder preguntas generales enmarcando la pregunta, convirtiéndola en un plan analítico, ejecutándola y comunicándola a las partes interesadas.
Ser el punto de contacto y account manager de los diferentes portales inmobiliarios (Idealista, Fotocasa, Habitaclia y otros), así como tener un control diario de nuestros competidores, para trabajar de forma transversal y definir prioridades y/o soluciones.
Analizar en profundidad las métricas operativas y la metodología de Engel & Völkers, para comprender los patrones de comportamiento de nuestros clientes y agentes inmobiliarios, y las posibles áreas de mejora.
Crear, modificar y resolver problemas para garantizar la entrega de análisis e informes precisos y claros.
Proporcionar información para respaldar la toma de decisiones.
Como Business Data Analyst, necesitarás generar confianza con Team Leaders y Sales Directors de todas nuestras oficinas en Madrid.




Ofrecemos:




- Contrato indefinido y jornada completa.




- Horario: De lunes a viernes de 9 a 18h.




- Trabajo en una empresa líder en su sector y formar parte de un equipo de alto rendimiento.




- 22 días laborables de vacaciones y tu día de cumpleaños libre.




- Posibilidad de teletrabajo.




- Acceso al Plan de Retribución Flexible (Seguro médico, Tickets guardería y más)







REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:




Licenciatura en un campo cuantitativo (Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Investigación de Operaciones u otro campo relacionado).
Conocimientos de paquete Office a nivel usuario y nivel de Excel y Google Sheet, preferiblemente avanzado. Valoraremos que tengas conocimientos en Data visualization y en otros software/plataformas estadísticas.
Experiencia iniciando e impulsando proyectos hasta su finalización.
Experiencia comunicando investigaciones complejas de manera clara, precisa y procesable.
Pensador crítico, innovador y solucionador de problemas.
Idiomas: inglés nivel medio.
Posibilidad de movilizarte a todas nuestras oficinas en Madrid.

Show more
