Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.




Position: Data Analyst

Location: Belgium

Type: Hybrid




Power Skills:

You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries;
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure;
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.




Technical and Soft Skills:




We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in PowerBI, Python, and Data Bases (SQL). As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, creating visualizations, and generating insights to support data-driven decision making within our organization. You will work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant analysis and reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proficient in data manipulation and analysis, and has a strong understanding of database concepts and data visualization techniques.




Responsibilities

Conduct data analysis using various tools and techniques, including PowerBI, Python, and SQL
Develop and implement data models and databases to support data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide them with timely and accurate analysis and reports
Identify trends and patterns in data and provide insights and recommendations based on analysis
Cleanse and transform data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate data findings
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques




Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a similar industry
Proficiency in PowerBI, Python, and SQL for data analysis and visualization
Strong knowledge of database concepts and ability to work with large datasets
Familiarity with data modeling and database design principles
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with minimal supervision
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner
Fluent inEnglish is mandatory
Fluency in French (C2 level) or Dutch (C1 level) is mandatory
Candidates must be in Europe already




Advantages of joining MoOngy:

International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.

Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.

Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.

Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.




@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At GemPool we are currently working with a dynamic startup based in Dublin, where innovation, learning, and growth drive their success. They are looking for a passionate and detail-oriented Data Engineer & Analyst to join their team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in creating and analyzing large datasets, generating business intelligence reports, and delivering data-driven insights for their clients. If you thrive on curiosity, creativity, and independent thinking, this is the perfect opportunity to make a significant impact and grow with us.




Core Responsibilities:

Data Preparation & Transformation: Conduct thorough data cleaning, transformation, and integration across various datasets to maintain high data quality.
Advanced Excel Analysis: Leverage advanced Excel techniques, including pivot tables, lookups, and complex formulas, to analyze and interpret large datasets.
Data Reconciliation: Perform data reconciliation and validation to identify and resolve discrepancies, ensuring consistency and accuracy.
Automation with Python & SQL: Utilize Python and SQL to streamline data processes, execute complex queries, and derive meaningful insights from extensive datasets.
Data Enrichment: Enhance existing datasets by extracting and integrating data from online sources and APIs, keeping information up-to-date and comprehensive.
Insightful Reporting: Create detailed reports and dashboards using business intelligence tools, translating data into actionable insights for clients and internal stakeholders.




Required Skills:

Proficient in Excel: Strong expertise in advanced Excel functions and tools for in-depth data analysis and reporting.
Python & SQL Expertise: Solid experience in using Python (with libraries like pandas and NumPy) and SQL for data manipulation and automation.
Data Quality Management: Proven ability in data cleaning, matching, and transformation to ensure high data integrity.
Data Extraction Skills: Knowledge of data scraping methods and tools for enriching and expanding datasets.
Experience with BI Tools: Familiarity with business intelligence platforms like AWS Quicksight, Tableau, or Power BI for creating impactful reports and visualizations.
Analytical & Innovative: Strong analytical abilities, with a creative mindset and a keen eye for detail, paired with a passion for discovering insights from data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

Uber is looking for Data Analysts to expand its new Team in Krakow.

The Krakow Center of Excellence is taking a new highway to become a major Technology Hub in Central & Eastern Europe, focusing on Process Optimization, Data Analytics & Automation.

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions.

As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists.

This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

About The Team

Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement.

In essence, the Team helps Uber to scale and best serve its users by performing work around two main pillars i) Analytics & Automation - data science, data analysis, query & dashboard creation, automation of business process, ii) Process - design, execution & optimization of business processes.

Located in Krakow, the Team is centralizing work for Uber Rides & Uber Eats, covering two mega-regions, i) United States & Canada, ii) Europe, Middle East, and Africa.

This experience gained as Data Analyst may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program.

We're offering a hybrid model of working (50% based out of our Krakow office, 50% work from home).

What You Will Do


Analyze data, identify trends and build meaningful recommendations
Present your results in a concise manner to international Stakeholders
Design, lead & execute projects independently or in coordination with peers
Conduct root cause analyses, build dashboards, prepare data-driven proposals


What you will need


Knowledges in SQL, Google Sheets
Analytical and data-driven approach for solving problems
Ability to work independently, on your own initiative
Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)

Title: Forecast Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Forecast Data Analyst

What you’ll have to do:

  • Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze historical data to identify trends, patterns, and key drivers of business performance;
  • Forecasting: Develop, test, and implement predictive models to forecast future demand, sales, inventory needs, or other key business metrics;
  • Model Validation: Continuously evaluate and refine forecasting models to ensure accuracy and reliability. Adjust models based on new data and changing business conditions;
  • Reporting: Create and deliver clear and concise reports and visualizations that communicate forecast results and insights to stakeholders, including executives, product managers, and operations teams;
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, supply chain, and IT, to align forecasting efforts with business needs and ensure data accuracy and consistency;
  • Scenario Analysis: Conduct “what-if” analyses to explore the impact of different scenarios on future outcomes and provide recommendations for strategic decision-making;
  • Data Quality: Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data used in forecasting models. Work with data engineers and IT to resolve any data quality issues;
  • Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in forecasting and data analytics. Propose and implement improvements to existing processes and models.


How we’d like you to be:

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree is preferred;
  • Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, forecasting, or a related role. Experience in FMCG is a plus;
  • Technical Skills:
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and SQL;
  • Advanced knowledge of data models;
  • Knowledge of implementing business processes on the data flow;
  • Strong skills in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI);
  • Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities and the capability to work with complex datasets;
  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner;
  • Attention to Detail: Meticulous in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data and models;
  • Time Management: Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively.


What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo un broker assicurativo con sede a Vigevano in provincia di Pavia.

Confrontiamo per il cliente finale i diversi preventivi offerti dalle compagnie assicurative e proponiamo il più vantaggioso, sulla base delle esigenze richieste. Inoltre, mettiamo la nostra piattaforma a disposizione dei dealer che collaborano con noi, in modo da permettere loro di offrire ai clienti oltre ad un servizio di vendita auto, anche una polizza. La nostra missione è quella di portare digitalizzazione e innovazione a tutti gli stakeholder del processo assicurativo dai singoli automobilisti ai partner assicurativi fino ai dealer e ai fleet manager.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una "IOT Analyst" che voglia lavorare nel settore delle Connected Cars. Il/la candidato/a ideale ha una profonda conoscenza della matematica e dei linguaggi di programmazione di base per l'analisi dei dati. Questo ruolo richiede una stretta collaborazione con i team di prodotto e vendite per massimizzare il valore dei nostri prodotti e servizi nel mercato delle auto connesse.




Responsabilità Principali

Analisi dei Dati: Utilizzare competenze matematiche per analizzare grandi quantità di dati generati dai veicoli connessi.
Collaborazione Interdisciplinare: Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team di prodotto per comprendere le esigenze del mercato e con il team di vendite per supportare strategie basate sui dati.
Innovazione Tecnologica: Rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tendenze tecnologiche nel campo delle auto connesse e proporre nuove soluzioni per migliorare i prodotti e i servizi.
Rapporti e Presentazioni: Preparare report dettagliati e presentazioni per condividere le analisi e le intuizioni con vari stakeholder interni.
Supporto Decisionale: Fornire supporto basato su dati per le decisioni di business e di prodotto.




Competenze Richieste

Conoscenza Matematica: Capacità di applicare concetti matematici avanzati per l'analisi dei dati.
Conoscenza dell'IoT e delle Auto Connesse: Comprensione delle tecnologie e dei trend relativi all'IoT e alle auto connesse.
Abilità di Comunicazione: Capacità di comunicare efficacemente con team interfunzionali, inclusi quelli di prodotto e vendite.
Analisi e Risoluzione dei Problemi: Forti capacità analitiche e di problem-solving.
Capacità di Lavorare in Team: Abilità di lavorare efficacemente in ambienti di squadra e interfunzionali.




Qualifiche Educative

Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica o Economia.
Eventuali certificazioni o corsi aggiuntivi in analisi dati, programmazione o tecnologie IoT saranno considerati un plus




Cosa offriamo

Contratto full time - Stage







Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L.903/77 eD.lgs. n.198/2006) e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità (D.lgs. 215/03 e 216/03)

Responsabilità Principali

  • Analisi dei Dati: Utilizzare competenze matematiche per analizzare grandi quantità di dati generati dai veicoli connessi.
  • Collaborazione Interdisciplinare: Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team di prodotto per comprendere le esigenze del mercato e con il team di vendite per supportare strategie basate sui dati.
  • Innovazione Tecnologica: Rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tendenze tecnologiche nel campo delle auto connesse e proporre nuove soluzioni per migliorare i prodotti e i servizi.
  • Rapporti e Presentazioni: Preparare report dettagliati e presentazioni per condividere le analisi e le intuizioni con vari stakeholder interni.
  • Supporto Decisionale: Fornire supporto basato su dati per le decisioni di business e di prodotto.


Competenze Richieste

  • Conoscenza Matematica: Capacità di applicare concetti matematici avanzati per l'analisi dei dati.
  • Conoscenza dell'IoT e delle Auto Connesse: Comprensione delle tecnologie e dei trend relativi all'IoT e alle auto connesse.
  • Abilità di Comunicazione: Capacità di comunicare efficacemente con team interfunzionali, inclusi quelli di prodotto e vendite.
  • Analisi e Risoluzione dei Problemi: Forti capacità analitiche e di problem-solving.
  • Capacità di Lavorare in Team: Abilità di lavorare efficacemente in ambienti di squadra e interfunzionali.


Qualifiche Educative

  • Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica o Economia.
  • Eventuali certificazioni o corsi aggiuntivi in analisi dati, programmazione o tecnologie IoT saranno considerati un plus


Cosa offriamo

  • Contratto full time - Stage



Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L.903/77 eD.lgs. n.198/2006) e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità (D.lgs. 215/03 e 216/03)

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
A little about us...

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.

· We provide our employees with a learning environment that promotes growth and creativity.

· To learn more please visit us at https://www.ltimindtree.com/Twitter @ https://twitter.com/ltimindtre




We are looking for Data Analyst with below expertise:




Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Westmeath is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team on a perm basis. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Job Responsibilities

Experienced and independent subject matter expert, capable of working on own initiative whilst delivering best practice solutions that deliver the strategic objectives.
Excellent problem solving skills
Strong quantitative analysis skills and experience in developing calculations to interpret and assess data sets to produce insight




Experience Required

Have a min of 5 years data analysis & reporting experience
Can demonstrate an ability to identify insights and report those insight’s to stakeholders.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience in data querying, data mining, data segmentation.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence strategies/design as it relates to Data analysis.
2+ years experience using statistical analysis languages (R, Python, etc.).




Essential and Desirable Skills

Financial Services




Educational Requirements

Relevant Degree




Working Hours & Benefits

38 Hour Working Week
Pension
Healthcare
Bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Chief Product Officer and partnering with ETU’s client advisors and account managers in the USA, the Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and mining complex behavioral data sources, deriving insights, and bringing data to life via innovative visualizations and reports. They will be responsible for liaising with both internal teams and external customers to understand business requirements, measures of success, and business impact metrics to deliver data and insights solutions to meet their business needs.

This role is based in Ireland, and you have the option of working remotely from home anywhere in Ireland or on a hybrid basis to our offices in Dublin 2.




ETU helps the world’s leading companies measure and develop skills to drive business performance. Employees apply workplace skills in realistic scenarios while the simulation platform measures their strengths and gaps. Rich data insights inform business decisions and guide skill development at scale.




Our story began on the campus of Trinity College Dublin, where a passionate group of PhD researchers saw the potential of immersive simulation for learners to unlock their true potential, rooted in skill mapping and demonstrating skill adoption through real-life scenarios. Our continued focus on a data-driven methodology has paved the way forward for ETU’s game-changing skill development and verification. With ETU, simulations are co-developed across the full range of critical skills with extensive experience demonstrated in six main categories: leadership, sales and service, diversity, equity and inclusion, onboarding, compliance and risk, and digital transformation. ETU brings a wealth of behavioral science to the creation of these engaging, impactful simulations that can help develop real-world, business-critical skills. 

Part of what makes ETU simulations so effective is that they begin with skill measurement. This is a critical starting point for tracking and personalizing any learning program. Learners can “test out” of material they do not need to review and “test up” to new levels of learning in line with their skill-based strengths and development areas. For more information, please visit: www.etu.co.




Responsibilities:

Analyzing and mining complex behavioral data sources, deriving insights, and bringing data to life via innovative visualisations
Liaising with internal teams and external customers to understand requirements and build solutions to meet their business needs
Preparing and communicating analytics and insights reports for both internal and external customers




Requirements:




Essential

Bachelor's degree or masters in a relevant field 
3+ years of experience in a similar role
Strong knowledge of Python is essential
Fluency in SQL and relational databases
Knowledge of statistical analysis tools such as QuickSight or similar (such as Tableau or PowerBI)




Desirable

Familiarity with JavaScript and HTML is a plus
Experience with AWS and GitHub is also beneficial
Deep analytical skills and problem-solving abilities
Expertise in data visualization techniques
Comfortable learning new technologies and working in a fast-paced environment
Preference for candidates with a background in industrial-organizational psychology or experience in HR/talent management.




Overseas applications will be declined as you must be permanently tax resident in Ireland for payroll purposes.




ETU is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend opportunities and benefits to employees without regard to race, religion, colour, sex, national origin, age, disability, veterans status or membership of the travelling community. This policy confirms ETU’s commitment to fair employment.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for an inquisitive and dedicated entry-level Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Does the idea of working with a large set of information and complex data, using innovative analysis techniques in order to achieve the best solutions for different businesses and for leading global brands in the market attract you?

We are aiming to recruit a recent graduate who’d like to join us as a Junior Data Analyst at our Advanced Analytics Centre of Excellence (CoE) team in Lisbon – with the opportunity to rapidly increase their expertise in the field of Data Science and Analytics, working and learning from a group of analysts and with some of the most powerful analysis tools and techniques that can be used to understand today’s data.

Using information from market-leading consumer panels and advanced data analysis techniques, you will support our customers’ needs and answer their toughest marketing-related questions with data insights and support their business growth.

You’ll be working with a team of like-minded Data Analysts within our Lisbon hub, carrying out data modelling processes for projects sold by our Expert Solutions teams around the world – you’ll work with a variety of different analytical techniques, datasets and brands to help answer a range of research and marketing questions from “How well did my advertising campaign perform?” to “Which products does my brand compete with?”.

At Worldpanel by Kantar, we are also currently embarking on a major shift in how we deliver analysis to our clients, with a new, best-in-class online platform (MyWorldPanel) through which we will deliver a suite of predictive analytics. This major development will not only step-change our client’s experience of using our data – you’ll also be involved in the transition of our analytics processes to this new cloud-based environment, helping to drive the quality, scale and efficiency of our solutions forward.

If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Work with Kantar Worldpanel local commercial teams to deliver analytical outputs for projects which will help our clients (brand owners and retailers) to better understand their markets and consumers.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data to help answer our clients’ business questions.
Work on the development of new skills, new analytical approaches and new ways of representing insight.
Work closely with other branches within the Centre of Excellence to support the development and improvement of advanced analytical techniques and the migration to a cloud-based platform.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Econometrics or equivalent quantitative fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum required).
Proven knowledge of SQL and R-Studio is mandatory.
Proven Knowledge/experience in SAS (Enterprise Guide) and Python although not required will be appreciated.


With the following qualities…


Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work optimally within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to connect with partners at all levels across the organization comfortably and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with TA.
3rd Stage – Final Meeting with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

Title: Data analysis stage
Description:
Ewiva ha l’obiettivo di costruire una rete di oltre 3.000 punti di ricarica ultra-veloci, ad alta potenza (fino a 350 kW) distribuiti in tutta Italia consentendo quindi di ricaricare su tutto il territorio nazionale, in qualsiasi momento, e ripartire in pochi minuti.




Il futuro sostenibile è oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralità climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.




Ewiva è una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilità elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.




Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.

Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuperà di:

Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management
Supporto nell'impostazione e nell'aggiornamento delle dashboard KPI in Microsoft PowerBI
Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management




Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
Capacità di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
Orientamento al cliente
Capacità di sviluppare presentazioni




Quali conosce ed esperienze vorremmo che avessi maturato in passato?

Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
Prima esperienza con Salesforce
Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
Inglese e italiano fluenti
Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia




Cosa aspetti a candidarti? Non vediamo l'ora di conoscerti!




Prima di inviare la tua candidatura, ti preghiamo di prendere visione dell’informativa privacy disponibile al seguente link: https://ewiva.com/privacy-policy-area-lavora-con-noi/.




Cosa ti offriamo?

Lo stage avrà una durata di 6 mesi.

Sarà previsto un rimborso mensile, rimborso dei pasti e la possibilità di lavorare in smart working.

Show more
HTML:
Ewiva ha l’obiettivo di costruire una rete di oltre 3.000 punti di ricarica ultra-veloci, ad alta potenza (fino a 350 kW) distribuiti in tutta Italia consentendo quindi di ricaricare su tutto il territorio nazionale, in qualsiasi momento, e ripartire in pochi minuti.


Il futuro sostenibile è oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralità climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.


Ewiva è una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilità elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.


Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.

Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuperà di:

  • Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management
  • Supporto nell'impostazione e nell'aggiornamento delle dashboard KPI in Microsoft PowerBI
  • Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
  • Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
  • Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
  • Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management


Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

  • Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
  • Capacità di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
  • Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
  • Orientamento al cliente
  • Capacità di sviluppare presentazioni


Quali conosce ed esperienze vorremmo che avessi maturato in passato?

  • Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
  • Prima esperienza con Salesforce
  • Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
  • Inglese e italiano fluenti
  • Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: Steenokkerzeel, Belgium

Languages: English

Type: Permanent Role

Job Description:

We are seeking a Junior Data Analyst to join our team. The main responsibilities include analyzing data and providing insights to support decision-making processes. The role involves working with Python for data manipulation and analysis, as well as using Tableau to create visualizations and dashboards. The ideal candidate should have a basic understanding of data analytics concepts and be eager to grow their skills in a dynamic environment.

Skills:

Python
tableau

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analysing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modelling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.




About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

⌚Hybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

💶Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K€]

🏝️Recharge days

🌍Our office is located in Madrid.

⌚Flexible work environment & hours.

🙌Regular team events.

🚗Cabify staff free rides.

🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.

🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

💻All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

🐱A pet room, so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home

☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo un broker assicurativo con sede a Vigevano in provincia di Pavia.

Confrontiamo per il cliente finale i diversi preventivi offerti dalle compagnie assicurative e proponiamo il più vantaggioso, sulla base delle esigenze richieste. Inoltre, mettiamo la nostra piattaforma a disposizione dei dealer che collaborano con noi, in modo da permettere loro di offrire ai clienti oltre ad un servizio di vendita auto, anche una polizza. La nostra missione è quella di portare digitalizzazione e innovazione a tutti gli stakeholder del processo assicurativo dai singoli automobilisti ai partner assicurativi fino ai dealer e ai fleet manager.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una "IOT Analyst" che voglia lavorare nel settore delle Connected Cars. Il/la candidato/a ideale ha una profonda conoscenza della matematica e dei linguaggi di programmazione di base per l'analisi dei dati. Questo ruolo richiede una stretta collaborazione con i team di prodotto e vendite per massimizzare il valore dei nostri prodotti e servizi nel mercato delle auto connesse.




Responsabilità Principali

Analisi dei Dati: Utilizzare competenze matematiche per analizzare grandi quantità di dati generati dai veicoli connessi.
Collaborazione Interdisciplinare: Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team di prodotto per comprendere le esigenze del mercato e con il team di vendite per supportare strategie basate sui dati.
Innovazione Tecnologica: Rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tendenze tecnologiche nel campo delle auto connesse e proporre nuove soluzioni per migliorare i prodotti e i servizi.
Rapporti e Presentazioni: Preparare report dettagliati e presentazioni per condividere le analisi e le intuizioni con vari stakeholder interni.
Supporto Decisionale: Fornire supporto basato su dati per le decisioni di business e di prodotto.




Competenze Richieste

Conoscenza Matematica: Capacità di applicare concetti matematici avanzati per l'analisi dei dati.
Conoscenza dell'IoT e delle Auto Connesse: Comprensione delle tecnologie e dei trend relativi all'IoT e alle auto connesse.
Abilità di Comunicazione: Capacità di comunicare efficacemente con team interfunzionali, inclusi quelli di prodotto e vendite.
Analisi e Risoluzione dei Problemi: Forti capacità analitiche e di problem-solving.
Capacità di Lavorare in Team: Abilità di lavorare efficacemente in ambienti di squadra e interfunzionali.




Qualifiche Educative

Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica o Economia.
Eventuali certificazioni o corsi aggiuntivi in analisi dati, programmazione o tecnologie IoT saranno considerati un plus




Cosa offriamo

Contratto full time - Stage







Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L.903/77 eD.lgs. n.198/2006) e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità (D.lgs. 215/03 e 216/03)

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
A little about us...

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.

· We provide our employees with a learning environment that promotes growth and creativity.

· To learn more please visit us at https://www.ltimindtree.com/Twitter @ https://twitter.com/ltimindtre




We are looking for Data Analyst with below expertise:




Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners










Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Show more
HTML:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.



THE ROLE

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
  • Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
  • Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
  • Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
  • Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making



WHAT YOU'LL BRING

  • At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
  • Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
  • Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
  • Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
  • Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
  • A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
  • A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
  • Fluent in German and English



WHAT WE OFFER

  • Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
  • Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
  • We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
  • 28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
  • 10 paid child’s sick days per year
  • Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
  • Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
  • In house conversational German classes for beginners
  • Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
  • Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
  • Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
  • Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners




Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Slovakia

Duration: 6 months contract

Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled Business Data Analyst to join our team in Slovakia for a 6-month contract position. The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in analyzing business data, interpreting trends, and providing insights to drive strategic decisions. This role will involve working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, develop analytical solutions, and present findings to stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

Collect and analyze business data from various sources to identify trends and patterns.
Interpret data and create insightful reports, dashboards, and presentations to support business decisions.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data analysis needs and provide actionable insights.
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and reporting systems.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency throughout all data-related projects.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Business Data Analyst or similar role with at least 5 years of experience.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling techniques is preferred.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to present complex information in a clear and understandable manner.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team environment.
Fluency in Slovakian and English languages is required.

Benefits:

Competitive compensation package based on experience and skills.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
Potential for extension or full-time employment based on performance and business needs.

My client based in Westmeath is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team on a perm basis. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.

Experienced and independent subject matter expert, capable of working on own initiative whilst delivering best practice solutions that deliver the strategic objectives.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Chief Product Officer and partnering with ETU’s client advisors and account managers in the USA, the Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and mining complex behavioral data sources, deriving insights, and bringing data to life via innovative visualizations and reports. They will be responsible for liaising with both internal teams and external customers to understand business requirements, measures of success, and business impact metrics to deliver data and insights solutions to meet their business needs.

This role is based in Ireland, and you have the option of working remotely from home anywhere in Ireland or on a hybrid basis to our offices in Dublin 2.




ETU helps the world’s leading companies measure and develop skills to drive business performance. Employees apply workplace skills in realistic scenarios while the simulation platform measures their strengths and gaps. Rich data insights inform business decisions and guide skill development at scale.




Our story began on the campus of Trinity College Dublin, where a passionate group of PhD researchers saw the potential of immersive simulation for learners to unlock their true potential, rooted in skill mapping and demonstrating skill adoption through real-life scenarios. Our continued focus on a data-driven methodology has paved the way forward for ETU’s game-changing skill development and verification. With ETU, simulations are co-developed across the full range of critical skills with extensive experience demonstrated in six main categories: leadership, sales and service, diversity, equity and inclusion, onboarding, compliance and risk, and digital transformation. ETU brings a wealth of behavioral science to the creation of these engaging, impactful simulations that can help develop real-world, business-critical skills. 

Part of what makes ETU simulations so effective is that they begin with skill measurement. This is a critical starting point for tracking and personalizing any learning program. Learners can “test out” of material they do not need to review and “test up” to new levels of learning in line with their skill-based strengths and development areas. For more information, please visit: www.etu.co.




Responsibilities:

Analyzing and mining complex behavioral data sources, deriving insights, and bringing data to life via innovative visualisations
Liaising with internal teams and external customers to understand requirements and build solutions to meet their business needs
Preparing and communicating analytics and insights reports for both internal and external customers




Requirements:




Essential

Bachelor's degree or masters in a relevant field 
3+ years of experience in a similar role
Strong knowledge of Python is essential
Fluency in SQL and relational databases
Knowledge of statistical analysis tools such as QuickSight or similar (such as Tableau or PowerBI)




Desirable

Familiarity with JavaScript and HTML is a plus
Experience with AWS and GitHub is also beneficial
Deep analytical skills and problem-solving abilities
Expertise in data visualization techniques
Comfortable learning new technologies and working in a fast-paced environment
Preference for candidates with a background in industrial-organizational psychology or experience in HR/talent management.




Overseas applications will be declined as you must be permanently tax resident in Ireland for payroll purposes.




ETU is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend opportunities and benefits to employees without regard to race, religion, colour, sex, national origin, age, disability, veterans status or membership of the travelling community. This policy confirms ETU’s commitment to fair employment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Uplight is creating a new category of energy. We make software that manages energy resources in homes and businesses—including things like smart thermostats, electric vehicles, solar panels, storage batteries, heat pumps, and even people’s behavior—to generate, shift, or save energy to balance the grid, making it more efficient and reliable. This creates clean energy capacity that can be used by the power grid instead of burning more fossil fuels. Our solutions accelerate the transition to clean energy and save money for energy customers.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to drive our company forward, and help us lead the clean energy revolution!

How You Will Make An Impact


Investigate and explore our diverse datasets and the products that create and use them
Work closely with a broad range of stakeholders, such as Customer Success Managers, Solution Architects, software engineers, and data scientists.
Quality data is key to quality results and you will be responsible for ensuring that the data is complete and accurately represents the customers data
You will work on Data collection initiatives: Gathering information from various sources
You will be responsible for troubleshooting issues resulting from data quality
Build out automation and tooling for recurring reports, including learning and practicing software engineering skills.
Be part of a rapidly growing Professional Services organization as we increase our capabilities to serve Uplight across our entire platform of products and services.
Passion for our mission and the stories we can tell with the data we provide.
Motivation to increase your ownership and responsibilities over time.
Compassion and team spirit to support our clients and your fellow teammates.
Curiosity and drive toward understanding and synthesizing complicated information sources across multiple platforms.
Ability to Identify trends that impact multiple clients or programs, summarize those trends with data, and drive visibility and action for a robust solution.
Transparency and traceability of time spent and internal/external communications.
Creation and maintenance of thorough documentation for data integration processes.
Ability to step back from initial problem statements and anticipate/see the larger issues and develop an action plan to ensure the systematic issue is identified and addressed.
Active communication with other teams to understand upstream and downstream requirements.
Ability to maintain a calm, professional demeanor under pressure.


What You Bring To Uplight


3-5 years' personal, professional, and/or educational experience with one or more of our team's core tasks: accessing data, analyzing data, transforming data, packaging data into reports, and managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders; OR the ability to demonstrate your skill in one or more of these tasks as part of the interview process.
Proficiency in two or more of the following:
Looker
SQL or other structured query languages.
Writing programs or scripts with Python or other languages.
Dashboarding, with an emphasis on automation.
Experience with one or more of: Amazon Web Services S3, Google Cloud Platform, other proprietary web-based applications and technologies of Data manipulation in Microsoft Excel or Looker, Tableau, or other Business Intelligence tools or other skills or training that are thematically similar to the above.
Patient, communicative, team player who is detail-oriented and has outstanding interpersonal skills.
Ability to collaborate across multiple time-zones and communication platforms.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, tenacity, and fortitude.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to balance multiple short- and long-term projects of varying scopes with clients across the country.
Vigorous written and oral communication skills.
Curiosity about and commitment to technology, energy efficiency and your potential.


Bonus Points


Experience working with SaaS, electric/gas utilities, or energy efficiency software.
Exposure to and understanding of Agile and other technical project management methodologies is a plus.
Experience handling personally identifiable information (PII)


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women, marginalized genders and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Uplight we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why Join Uplight in Leading the Fight Against Climate Change?

At Uplight, We're Not Just Offering a Job – We're Offering a Chance To Be Part Of The Solution To One Of The World's Biggest Challenges. As a Certified B Corporation, We're Deeply Committed To Both Social And Environmental Responsibility. Here's Why You Should Join Our Team Of Passionate Uplighters


Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work directly impacts our mission of decarbonization and building a more sustainable future.
Grow Your Career: We offer ample advancement opportunities, robust learning and development programs, and a supportive team environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.
Thrive: We offer comprehensive benefits, including flexible time off, generous parental leave, a wellness stipend, and work flexibility to help you thrive both personally and professionally.
Belong to an Inclusive Community: We celebrate diversity and foster an inclusive workplace where everyone feels respected, empowered, and heard. Our Employee Resource Groups offer opportunities to connect with colleagues who share your interests and backgrounds.
Be Part of a Growing Movement: Join a team of dedicated individuals who are passionate about creating a more sustainable future. We offer a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions recognized. Together, we can build a brighter tomorrow.


To learn more about our comprehensive benefits package and other perks, visit uplight.com/careers

Salary Range: $70,000 to $85,000 + Bonus

Application Deadline: July 31, 2024

In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.

Uplight provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race (including hair texture and hairstyles), color, religion (including head coverings), age, sex, national origin, disability status (including neurodivergence), genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, neurotypicality, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst, Institutional Data and Analytics
Description:
At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Most importantly, we seek people who are excited about crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.

Who You Are


You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there.
You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0.
You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.


Institutional Operations Solutions are responsible for the day to day operations and support of Coinbase’s suite of Institutional Products and Services. We are focused on managing risk and building scale in operations processes as well as providing exceptional customer service to our Institutional clients. As a Data Analyst on our team, you will help drive business impact through data. You will have the opportunity to transform data into valuable business insights and help shape our strategy by establishing critical metrics, building visualizations, and automating reporting.

What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties)


Improve operational efficiency and risk management by developing metrics, self-service tools, and deep analyses that drive actionable insights.
Proactively identify opportunity areas for improvement including reporting automation, deep dive investigations, and new analytical partnerships.
Collaborate in a tight-knit team environment to foster efficient execution, innovation, and continuous improvement.
Develop and support the analytical technologies that empower our team to have timely, flexible, and structured access to our data.
Collaborate with multiple operations teams to manage an analytic roadmap.
Drive the vision, building, and adoption of self-service analytic capabilities; develop these capabilities at scale.
Understand data resources and know when, how, and which best to use for each project.
Work cross-functionally with other data owners to to maximize consistency and establish best practices.
Frame and break down complex business problems into key components and recommend practical solutions.
Monitor key performance metrics and use data to identify actionable opportunities to minimize risk and increase efficiency.


What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements)


3+ years of experience working with data in a relevant function (e.g. operations, finance, business analytics, etc.).
Advanced SQL and data modeling skills, Python experience a plus.
Motivated by Coinbase’s mission, crypto and delivering an exceptional Institutional product to our customers.
Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Looker, Tableau, QuickSight, SuperSet, etc.)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required, including experience meeting with and communicating information to senior leadership.
Highly collaborative, with an ability to gather and balance inputs from many cross-functional partner teams.
Ability to think strategically, formulate appropriate analytical solutions, and execute in order to solve business needs.
Highly flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a high-growth, fast paced organization.


Nice To Haves


Report automation experience (e.g. using Apache Airflow, Python, etc.).
Deep subject matter expertise and experience in crypto and financial services, including risk management.
Experience with financial industry regulations.
Experience with descriptive and inferential statistics.
Experience with customer support metrics/data.


Job #: P57441

Pay Transparency Notice: Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).

Pay Range

$131,325—$154,500 USD

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view the Know Your Rights notice here. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.
