Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Senior Business Data Analyst(Must Have Data Governance Experience)

Location: Boston, MA (Day 1 Onsite)

Experience: 10+ Years

Work type: C2C only

PETADATA is currently looking to hire for the position of Senior Business Data Analyst for one of their clients.

Roles & Responsibilities


Experience in writing and understanding SQL queries Identify opportunities to accomplish project goals most efficiently and cost-effectively. Business Requirements Management and Solution Development.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to fully understand, define, and document business requirements for software and/or process changes through a variety of means focusing on medium to high-complexity projects, processes, and functional areas of the applications.
Conduct user interviews, surveys, workflow reviews, and research on industry best practices and user workshops documenting current(As-Is) and Future (To-Be) scenarios including processes, models, use cases, plans, flow diagrams, requirements write-ups, and solutions.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.


Required Skills


Data analysis skills with experience using enterprise tools such as Informatica, Ataccama, Collibra, and/or other metadata management tools and Delphix/Informatica or other data privacy/compliance tools.
Strong knowledge of and experience with GCP/AWS/Azure, SQL Server, Oracle, Snowflake, etc.
Must have experience with data governance as a practice, including enterprise data management, data lifecycle management, data anonymization & masking, data quality, data lineage, data privacy, data security, metadata management, data analytics and reporting, and artificial intelligence(AI).
Extensive understanding and experience in data governance and data initiatives and defining Data Retention strategy and objectives while enabling business values.
Drive and challenge business users on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans. Proactively identify ways in which system and process changes can improve the efficiency of key users, customer service, accuracy of results, and/or completeness of data.
Act as a change agent to help ensure that assumptions, development, and implementation of new systems/processes enhance the success of the project and increase the project’s alignment with the business needs.
Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure that requirements are properly translated into technical specifications, clarify requirements, review recommendations, and answer questions.
Collaborate and build consensus between the technical team and stakeholders working to balance scope, speed to market, and available resources.
Ensure that all processes and documentation are consistent with best practices and Bright Horizons standards for the Solution Delivery Life Cycle.
Drive the development of a master test plan with the QE team that traces business requirements throughout the SDLC and ensures that all process steps are followed.
Work with Application Support, Training, Implementation, QE, and development in a business analysis capacity both reactively and proactively to support application issues, changes, and modifications.
Organize and lead projects from inception to execution including creating and managing task lists, project schedules, budget, etc.
Work effectively with vendors to fully scope and estimate initiatives that meet cost, scope, and timeline objectives and constraints.


Educational Qualification

Bachelor's/ Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

We offer a professional work environment and are given every opportunity to grow in the Information technology world.

Note

Candidates are required to attend Phone/Video Call / In-person interviews and after Selection of candidate (He/She) should go through all background checks on Education and Experience.

Please email your resume to: jhansib@petadata.co

After carefully reviewing your experience and skills one of our HR team members will contact you on the next steps.

Title: Analyst - Promotions Analytics
Description:
This is a hybrid position based out of our Boston, MA office (Mon - Thurs Onsite, Friday Remote).

Who We Are

Wayfair is THE destination for all things home: helping everyone, anywhere create their feeling of home. Wayfair’s promotions aim to improve the customer buying experience by delivering exciting and inspiring moments through surfacing deals and aiding discovery of new products. The Promotions Analytics team is focused on testing new ideas, informing strategy change and working to scale processes for Wayfair promotions.

We are looking for an Analyst to join our team and leverage data-driven decision making, technical expertise, and strong communication skills through work with our Promotions, Specialty Retail Brand, marketing, and operations teams to deliver a best in class Promotions experience for Wayfair customers. This role provides a distinct opportunity to influence decisions that have significant impact on the Promotions function at Wayfair. Promotions Analysts constantly use data to drive profitable top line revenue for Promotions events, while working cross-functionally to optimize event concepting, products selection and value proposition. In addition, building business logic and automation capabilities to scale Wayfair promotions offerings are a core focus of the role. Our Analysts play a key role in building cutting edge ‘Big Data’ and leveraging these unique, proprietary, and massive datasets, coupled with a constant flow of experimentation on consumer response to answer thorny questions that guide the Wayfair promotions strategy.

What You’ll Do


Effectively communicate actionable insights across a wide audience with varying technical expertise, including Senior Leadership and other partners in our Promotions, Specialty Retail Brands, Exclusive Brands, marketing, and operations teams.
Leverage BI tooling to develop easily digestible and user friendly data visualizations, reporting, and data solutions, and train our partners on relevant applications to promote long term adoption of these products.
Ensure our promotions, operations and marketing partners have the tools, data, and reporting they need to make decisions, especially those around assortment creation, promotions, branding, and marketing.
Approach broad and complex problems from a technical lens, supporting automation, big data management and comprehension, and predictive analytics and modeling to generate applicable insights and recommendations.
Work closely with analytics and data engineering partners across all areas of the business to create accurate and high-impact solutions to address opportunity areas within the organization.


What You’ll Need


Bachelor’s Degree in analytics, statistics, economics, finance, or a related field
0-2 years of experience in a quantitative or analytical role
Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings
Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills: ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with any programming language is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set (Google BigQuery/SQL, R, Python)


About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

Title: Quantitative Researcher Intern, Summer 2025
Description:
Team Overview

We are looking for Quantitative Researcher Interns to join our Research group. We are a collaborative, data-driven, intellectually rigorous team responsible for coming up with investment ideas, codifying those ideas into signals, back-testing the signals, and producing return, risk and trading cost forecasts based on the signals to drive trading decisions. We maintain a friendly, team-oriented environment and place a high value on professionalism, attitude and initiative.

As a Quantitative Researcher Intern, you will be immersed in our research effort, working side-by-side with members of the Research group. Our intern program combines theory, practice and technology and provides significant insights into quantitative investment management. You will work on high impact projects that may involve finance, data science, applied math, optimization theory and computer programming.

Responsibilities

Typical responsibilities include:


Performing statistical analysis across multiple large complex data sets from a variety of structured and unstructured sources
Researching predictable patterns in asset returns, risks, trading costs and other data relevant to financial markets
Performing portfolio construction research using our proprietary simulation capability


Qualifications


Enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program from an educational institution in finance, mathematics, economics, or a closely-related discipline emphasizing quantitative and financial analysis. Expected degree completion within a year of the internship.
Demonstrated academic success
Strong analytical, quantitative, programming and problem solving skills
Understanding of probability, statistics, linear regression, time-series analysis, linear algebra, calculus, optimization and portfolio theory
Experience with a statistical computing environment such as STATA, R, MATLAB, or Python
Knowledge of the application of statistics to economics (including econometrics or regression analysis)
Experience analyzing large data sets
Passion for financial markets
Excellent communication skills, including data visualization
High energy and strong work ethic


Please include your academic transcript(s) upon submission of your application.

We maintain a friendly, team-oriented environment and place a high value on professionalism, attitude and initiative.

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
Job tile : Data Analyst Senior

Duration: 12 months

Location: Quincy(Hybrid)

Summary

The Client's Data Office is seeking a Data Analyst to join its growing team. The Data Office is leading a central Data Modernization program that will include new central data capabilities, as well as improvements and coordination with its 12 constituent agencies. Under the direction of the Director of Data Strategy and working closely with Agency teams and the Strategy Office, the Data Analyst will support the creation of analytics and dashboards to monitor Secretariat initiatives and outcomes. The initial focus will be on aggregate Key Performance Indicators from various Agencies. As the program matures, there will be opportunities to dive deeper with data, combining data from multiple agencies to create a fuller picture of the health of the constituents of Massachusetts and how the client is engaging with them and delivering services. In the first 6 months of the project, the team will be working to create a shared Enterprise Data Platform and to define and understand the KPIs from EHS agencies. Team members will engage directly with Agency teams to understand their technical landscape, business objectives, and gaps in current data capabilities. As the program matures, data from various sources will be integrated into the Enterprise Data Platform and attention will shift to be more stable, production-ready delivery of dashboards using Snowflake & Tableau.

The Data Analyst will support the Data Office in its efforts to implement a new central Data modernization program. The Data Analyst will provide input on best practices and potential efficiencies, work on multiple assignments concurrently to meet aggressive due dates. The Data Analyst will use a range of expert technical skills based on a keen knowledge of data and analytic concepts, and must be proficient with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools. This resource needs to have hands on experience analyzing and interpreting complex data needs to develop solutions that improve decision making and operational efficiency. This resource will also be responsible for providing subject matter expertise in the development of requirements as agencies transition to the data modernization program.

In the initial stages of the engagement, the Analyst will be expected to work with data from multiple disparate sources to meet reporting goals. This will be data of varying completeness and quality from systems such as EHRs, enrollment platforms, and operations applications.As the Enterprise Data Platform matures and more data is integrated and improved, the Analyst will use their schools to generate data sets and analysis based on objects in Snowflake. The ideal candidate is comfortable in a maturing landscape and is able to use their data skills and business understanding to answer questions with imperfect systems.

Detailed List Of Job Duties And Responsibilties


Develop reports and data visualizations using Tableau Server
Provide ad-hoc reports and extract based on user requests
Provide gap analysis of current data extract process
Identify remediation of data pipeline process gaps and propose solutions
Validate results of all extracts and reports
Interact on a professional basis with internal and external staff in a personable manner
Develop reports for the Office of Strategy Management and other areas as requested
Support on-going development of Key Performance Indicator Collection Tools and Reports
Communicate business requirements to developers and work with them to implement solutions for the business community where appropriate.
Communicate progress, or impediments to progress, to users and managers.
Organize and maintain workload and work independently with limited supervision
Participate in, and contribute to, team projects and meetings


QUALIFICATIONS (Special Skill Set, Abilities & Knowledge)


Mange assigned requests from a variety of diverse business users
Understand business requirements, regulatory needs and their impact on business as well as well as the technology essential to support them
Maintain comprehensive code and documentation consistent with best practices and agency policy
Evaluation requests, gather business requirements and creatively develop solutions, generating accurate deliverables consistently and under pressure
Improve and innovate processes and programs that meeting user needs
Produce standard and ad hoc reports using various tools and data sources
Conduct advanced data mining in a timely and accurate manner as required
Produce business and system documentation based on Client standards


EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Education, Year' Experience & Certificates):


BS in Computer Science, related degree, or equivalent experience
Experience working with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools required
3+ years' experience working as a programmer/developer, preferably in healthcare

HTML:
Job tile : Data Analyst Senior

Duration: 12 months

Location: Quincy(Hybrid)

Summary

The Client's Data Office is seeking a Data Analyst to join its growing team. The Data Office is leading a central Data Modernization program that will include new central data capabilities, as well as improvements and coordination with its 12 constituent agencies. Under the direction of the Director of Data Strategy and working closely with Agency teams and the Strategy Office, the Data Analyst will support the creation of analytics and dashboards to monitor Secretariat initiatives and outcomes. The initial focus will be on aggregate Key Performance Indicators from various Agencies. As the program matures, there will be opportunities to dive deeper with data, combining data from multiple agencies to create a fuller picture of the health of the constituents of Massachusetts and how the client is engaging with them and delivering services. In the first 6 months of the project, the team will be working to create a shared Enterprise Data Platform and to define and understand the KPIs from EHS agencies. Team members will engage directly with Agency teams to understand their technical landscape, business objectives, and gaps in current data capabilities. As the program matures, data from various sources will be integrated into the Enterprise Data Platform and attention will shift to be more stable, production-ready delivery of dashboards using Snowflake & Tableau.

The Data Analyst will support the Data Office in its efforts to implement a new central Data modernization program. The Data Analyst will provide input on best practices and potential efficiencies, work on multiple assignments concurrently to meet aggressive due dates. The Data Analyst will use a range of expert technical skills based on a keen knowledge of data and analytic concepts, and must be proficient with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools. This resource needs to have hands on experience analyzing and interpreting complex data needs to develop solutions that improve decision making and operational efficiency. This resource will also be responsible for providing subject matter expertise in the development of requirements as agencies transition to the data modernization program.

In the initial stages of the engagement, the Analyst will be expected to work with data from multiple disparate sources to meet reporting goals. This will be data of varying completeness and quality from systems such as EHRs, enrollment platforms, and operations applications.As the Enterprise Data Platform matures and more data is integrated and improved, the Analyst will use their schools to generate data sets and analysis based on objects in Snowflake. The ideal candidate is comfortable in a maturing landscape and is able to use their data skills and business understanding to answer questions with imperfect systems.

Detailed List Of Job Duties And Responsibilties

  • Develop reports and data visualizations using Tableau Server
  • Provide ad-hoc reports and extract based on user requests
  • Provide gap analysis of current data extract process
  • Identify remediation of data pipeline process gaps and propose solutions
  • Validate results of all extracts and reports
  • Interact on a professional basis with internal and external staff in a personable manner
  • Develop reports for the Office of Strategy Management and other areas as requested
  • Support on-going development of Key Performance Indicator Collection Tools and Reports
  • Communicate business requirements to developers and work with them to implement solutions for the business community where appropriate.
  • Communicate progress, or impediments to progress, to users and managers.
  • Organize and maintain workload and work independently with limited supervision
  • Participate in, and contribute to, team projects and meetings

QUALIFICATIONS (Special Skill Set, Abilities & Knowledge)

  • Mange assigned requests from a variety of diverse business users
  • Understand business requirements, regulatory needs and their impact on business as well as well as the technology essential to support them
  • Maintain comprehensive code and documentation consistent with best practices and agency policy
  • Evaluation requests, gather business requirements and creatively develop solutions, generating accurate deliverables consistently and under pressure
  • Improve and innovate processes and programs that meeting user needs
  • Produce standard and ad hoc reports using various tools and data sources
  • Conduct advanced data mining in a timely and accurate manner as required
  • Produce business and system documentation based on Client standards

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Education, Year' Experience & Certificates):

  • BS in Computer Science, related degree, or equivalent experience
  • Experience working with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools required
  • 3+ years' experience working as a programmer/developer, preferably in healthcare

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
The Health Connector is seeking a Reporting Analyst to work with Health Connector staff and stakeholders to produce accurate, validated, sustainable, and timely reports. The Reporting Analyst is a member of the Data, Analytics & Reporting team within the Operations department and is the interface with stakeholders to ensure reports and data requests are managed and delivered timely and accurately. The Reporting Analyst reports to the Director of Data & Analytics, while working closely and collaboratively with a variety of teams in support of Health Connector programs.




Key Responsibilities Include:




Ensure reporting deliverables are met, and any issues escalated appropriately.
Work with Health Connector staff and stakeholders to define, document and communicate business and report requirements, expected outcomes, results, and other preferences.
Develop and maintain user guides for all reports.
Demonstrate reporting best practices to ensure the accurate collection, analysis, and distribution of reports such that the enterprise report catalog is manageable and sustainable.
Ensure that data is validated, reconciled and contextually consistent across all internal and external reports.
Ensure all reporting deliverables are tracked, managed, accurate and on time.
Interpret data, analyze, and validate results, and help develop ad hoc and recurring reports to support strategic, operational, and financial decision-making in a timely manner.
Identify opportunities to standardize, automate and provide self-service reports in response to and in anticipation of business needs.
Understand Health Connector program requirements, business processes, and systems management.




Basic Requirements:




Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, finance, information technology, computer science or related field.
3+ years of progressive experience and skill with business requirement gathering, report development, communication of findings, data analysis.
Ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, data analysts, and technical resources.
Advanced Excel skills (preferably in a healthcare setting), and reporting and analytical packages (Tableau preferred).
Strong customer focus with the demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships.
Experience working with large amounts of complex relational data from different databases and data sources.
Excellent technical writing skills to prepare outward facing publicly available analytical documents and reports and ability to explain results accurately and concisely to both technical/non-technical colleagues and stakeholders.
Excellent presentation and data visualization skills.
Excellent time management skills and ability to manage competing priorities.







If interested: Send a cover letter and résumé to Connector-jobs@mass.gov.




Salary: $80,000-85,000/year




Please note:

Due to the requirement of 268A, please complete the Applicant Disclosure Form and return it with your application. Link - https://www.mahealthconnector.org/wp-content/uploads/ApplicantsDisclosureForm.pdf




All Health Connector employees are required to provide satisfactory proof of eligibility to work in the United States




All Health Connector employees are required to provide satisfactory proof of full COVID-19 vaccination.




The Health Connector is operating on a hybrid work arrangement with 2 days in the downtown Boston office and 3 days working from home.




Employee may be requested to work an extended day and weekends to meet deadlines




About the Health Connector:

The Commonwealth Health Insurance Connector Authority (Massachusetts Health Connector) is an independent public authority serving as the Affordable Care Act (ACA)-compliant marketplace for the Commonwealth. The organization is charged with providing subsidized and unsubsidized health insurance to individuals and small employers. The Health Connector also oversees policy development related to health care reform under both state and federal laws, as well as conducting public education and outreach about health care reform and coverage opportunities.

The Health Connector is an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity as a vital characteristic of its workforce. We consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual identity, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Title: Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
Boston, United States of America

Summary Of Responsibilities

This position is for a 10-week Summer Internship. The Data & Analytics Intern will support a line of business support our CBB Strategy and Delivery within Consumer and Digital Transformation.

This 2024 Summer Internship is for graduate students who have an anticipated graduation date between December 2024 and June 2025.

This internship position is located in Boston, MA. Before applying, please keep in mind that our internship program does not offer any relocation assistance.

To learn more about our summer internship program and the activities included, please visit https://www.santandercareers.com/students.

Essential Functions

The intern will work in our Data & Analytics Center of Excellence (DA-CoE) team, that focuses on the following activities:


Customer insights to enable product strategy and profitable growth
Data engineering to enable customer-360 data and insights
Predictive models for customer acquisition and deepening
Advanced analytics to understand channel behavior
Business Intelligence across channels, products and transformation initiatives


Requirements


A graduate student with an expected graduation date between Fall 2024 - Spring 2025
Major in a quantitative discipline or significant coursework in data science / data engineering
A cumulative GPA or 3.5 or above
Excellent written and verbal English language skills
Familiarity with Python, R, SQL, or a similar programming language
Experience with Excel and PowerPoint
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Adaptability to work in a fast-paced market environment
Solid professional and personal work ethic
Ability to work independently on special projects
Ability to work in an environment that supports employees from all backgrounds and fosters an environment of inclusion.


Working Conditions


Extended working hours may be required as dictated by management and business needs.
Travel to multiple facilities may be required.
May be required to lift, push, or pull materials weighing up to twenty (20) pounds.
May be required to sit and review information on a computer screen for long periods of time.
May require repetitive motions of the hands and wrist related to writing and typing at an electronic keyboard.
Corporate / satellite office role.


Diversity & EEO Statements: At Santander, we value and respect differences in our workforce and strive to increase the diversity of our teams. We actively encourage everyone to apply.

Santander is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Working Conditions: Frequent Minimal physical effort such as sitting, standing and walking. Occasional moving and lifting equipment and furniture is required to support onsite and offsite meeting setup and teardown. Physically capable of lifting up to fifty pounds, able to bend, kneel, climb ladders.

Employer Rights: This job description does not list all of the job duties of the job. You may be asked by your supervisors or managers to perform other duties. You may be evaluated in part based upon your performance of the tasks listed in this job description. The employer has the right to revise this job description at any time. This job description is not a contract for employment and either you or the employer may terminate at any time for any reason.

The base pay range for this position is posted below and represents the annualized salary range. For hourly positions (non-exempt), the annual range is based on a 40-hour work week. The exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, training, licensure and certifications and location.

Salary: $83,200 - $83,200/year

Primary Location: Boston, MA, Boston

Other Locations: Massachusetts-Boston

Organization: Santander Bank N.A.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/F/Vet/Disabled/SO

RippleMatch is your AI-powered job matchmaker. Our platform brings opportunities directly to you by matching you with top employers and jobs you are qualified for. Tell us about your strengths and goals - we'll get you interviews! Title: Lead Data Analyst
Company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Description:
Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.

What We Need

The Lead Data Analyst will support delivery across multiple data platforms including the cloud-based Data Analytics Layer (DAL) and the on-prem Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). The Lead Data Analyst will support new solutions, enhancements, operational changes, and the migration of existing EDW applications and solutions to the DAL. The Lead Data Analyst will work closely with technology vendor partners to support data ingestion, transformation, storage, and delivery for operational and analytical solutions. This role will work closely with data scrum teams including developers, testers, scrum masters, product owners, and subject matter experts.

As a member of the Agile scrum team, the Lead Data Analyst will conduct spike analysis to support estimation, scheduling, and backlog refinement activities. They will enhance user stories with technical specifications to support development and testing. This role will participate or lead cross-functional team meetings as a representative of the Data Analytics and Insights team to ensure capabilities, technology, resource capacity, and delivery status are communicated and understood by enterprise partners. This role will also work with developers and testers to address open questions and clarify requirements and specifications defined in user stories.

Your Day to Day


Lead cross-divisional project teams in the implementation of data driven projects for consumers, providers, and accounts.
Create data specific artifacts supporting portfolio initiatives, projects, and operational enhancements.
Act as liaison with internal and external (vendor) teams to deliver requirements, specifications, and definitions required for successful Agile implementation.
Participate in scrum ceremonies and support the definition of epics and user stories using Jira.
Build, organize, and maintain and process, technical, and solution specific content including design documents, roadmaps, data mapping, reference documents, and workflows in Confluence.


We’re Looking For


Deep knowledge of healthcare data domains including (but not limited to) enrollment, account, claims, providers, products, digital, clinical, financial, and wellness data.
Designs, develops, and programs operational data integration, extracts, reports, dashboards, and scorecards to support complex business needs of internal partners.
Leverages an expansive knowledge of structured query language (SQL) to program and creates reports for the informatics/analyst community.
Builds deep knowledge of healthcare domain by engaging in delivery, operations, & analytics initiatives
Provides complex operational analysis on healthcare data sets and maintains Health Informatics web content.
Assists in the data definitions requirements critical to the successful implementation of data-driven projects through the development of effective working relationships with key internal and external customers.
Knowledge and understanding of data ingestion, transformation, storage, security, and exchange.
Experience developing queries using data mining and/or business intelligence tools.
Experience translating enterprise requirements into technical specifications for development teams.
Knowledge of data validation approaches to confirm and document results meet expectations.
Ability to estimate, inform, and negotiate expectations that meet enterprise partner and technical delivery needs.
Experience working on Agile teams to deliver ongoing value throughout the entire product lifecycle.


What You Bring


Bachelors degree preferred
10+ years data analyst experience
5+ years of experience in healthcare
5+ years of experience using SQL and BI tools


What You’ll Gain

It is our mission at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts to foster a culture that enables associates to do their best work while living happy and healthy lives. That's why we offer you a variety of ways to support your best physical, emotional, financial, and social well-being. For more information on our benefit offerings, visit https://careers.bluecrossma.org/us/en/benefits

Minimum Education Requirements

High school degree or equivalent required unless otherwise noted above

Location

Boston, Hingham

Time Type

Full time

Salary Range: $130,000.00 - $164,010.00

The job posting range is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, and business or organizational needs and affordability.

This job is also eligible for variable pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and a suite of well-being benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

WHY Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA?

We understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can prevent amazing candidates coming our way, so please don’t hesitate to apply. We’d love to hear from you. You might be just what we need for this role or possibly another one at Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be brilliant. We encourage you to bring us your true colors, , your perspectives, and your experiences. It’s in our differences that we will remain relentless in our pursuit to transform healthcare for ALL.

As an employer, we are committed to investing in your development and providing the necessary resources to enable your success. Learn how we are dedicated to creating an inclusive and rewarding workplace that promotes excellence and provides opportunities for employees to forge their unique career path by visiting our Company Culture page. If this sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you. You can also join our Talent Community to stay “in the know” on all things Blue.

At Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, we believe in wellness and that work/life balance is a key part of associate wellbeing. For more information on how we work and support that work/life balance visit our "How We Work" Page.

Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.

What We Need

The Lead Data Analyst will support delivery across multiple data platforms including the cloud-based Data Analytics Layer (DAL) and the on-prem Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). The Lead Data Analyst will support new solutions, enhancements, operational changes, and the migration of existing EDW applications and solutions to the DAL. The Lead Data Analyst will work closely with technology vendor partners to support data ingestion, transformation, storage, and delivery for operational and analytical solutions. This role will work closely with data scrum teams including developers, testers, scrum masters, product owners, and subject matter experts.

As a member of the Agile scrum team, the Lead Data Analyst will conduct spike analysis to support estimation, scheduling, and backlog refinement activities. They will enhance user stories with technical specifications to support development and testing. This role will participate or lead cross-functional team meetings as a representative of the Data Analytics and Insights team to ensure capabilities, technology, resource capacity, and delivery status are communicated and understood by enterprise partners. This role will also work with developers and testers to address open questions and clarify requirements and specifications defined in user stories.

Your Day to Day

  • Lead cross-divisional project teams in the implementation of data driven projects for consumers, providers, and accounts.

Title: CMC Statistician/Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Framingham, MA


this role is comparable to an Associate Director level


About The Job

Are you ready to shape the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. The CMC-Biologics Statistics team is seeking an expert data scientist / Statistician to support the CMC activities for process, analytical methods and formulation development, in the US, across our Boston area sites. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress.

As part of the development of Sanofi’s pharmaceutical products, the R&D Data Sciences department and more specifically the Statistics department for the Chemical Manufacturing Control (CMC) of biological products (CMC-Biologics Statistics), is responsible for contributing to statistical support, modeling, digitalization, decision-making and filing of new product registration files.

Main Responsibilities


Provide statistical analysis to support CMC project teams, including work packages intended for submission to the Agencies,
Provide the statistical components of responses to regulatory authority questions.
Responsible for the definition of complex studies supporting the product control strategy, using Statistical and Machine Learning algorithms.
Contribute to the design and support of Data Science applications (in Rshiny / Python / SAS) to be used by CMC scientists.
Ensure effective collaborations with other statistical leaders, scientific project leaders and senior leadership to advance the definition of robust control strategy across CMC
Deliver training sessions for CMC scientists in statistical methodologies, machine learning and software applications,
Act as a promotor of data science / Statistical culture across CMC by developing statistical activities, mentorship, guidance, teamwork, quality, operational efficiency, innovation and promote a productive work environment.


About You


Proficient in the statistical software used as standard in Sanofi (JMP, MODDE, SIMCA)
Ability to develop and deploy Applications used by non-experts’ data scientists
Proficient in validation or transfer studies of analytical methods, specification calculations, comparability studies, product stability studies, optimization, or robustness experimental designs
PhD/MS in statistics or related discipline with a minimum of 7-10+ years of pharmaceutical experience
Proven knowledge of Bayesian and Machine Learning algorithms with proficiency in programming in standard languages e.g., R, R/Shiny, Python or SAS and advanced statistical concepts and techniques applied to process development activities.
Broad knowledge of (bio)pharmaceutical development and CMC activities in a regulatory context, including good understanding of GMP activities and Quality by Design framework
Ability to represent Sanofi in cross-company activities such as consortium or professional associations.


Why Choose Us?


Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.
Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave.


Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.

#GD-SA

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Senior Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis, experimentation and reporting. Additionally, you will develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and own delivery results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues, deal with ambiguity and manage conflicting deadlines.

What does an average day look like?


Driving Results: Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments. Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels.
Taking Ownership: Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance.
Making Decisions: Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership.
Cultivating Relationships: Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence.
Instilling Trust: Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors.
Customer Focus: Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams. Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals.


What background should you have?


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree. Master’s preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
2+ years of DTC, Ecommerce, and/or Retail experience, preferred.
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability
Ability to work independently and autonomously, as well as part of a team


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)
Employee discounts on Cirkul products
New corporate office space with great amenities
Opportunity to work with a best in class team, in a hyper growth company, taking over the hydration industry
A culture that rewards results


Please review our privacy policy here .

Cirkul, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to sustaining an equitable and inclusive, people-first environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Integrity Lab creates intelligent technology to foster integrity within the world’s leading organizations. Our data-driven advisory team analytically investigates the most pressing integrity challenges facing organizations, including fraud, bribery, and harassment. We employ cutting-edge approaches to proactively mitigate misconduct.




Our Cambridge-based team, led by a Harvard Business School Professor, has diverse expertise in data science, statistics, econometrics, engineering, and software design. We routinely support organizations facing significant public and regulatory scrutiny.




We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our innovative and dynamic team. In this role, you will partner with industry-leading US multinationals to solve their critical compliance analytics needs. You will have the opportunity to work with rich, proprietary datasets to generate actionable managerial insights. You will communicate complex data insights through visualizations, reports, and presentations to senior stakeholders at our clients. You will further contribute to groundbreaking internal research projects to shape the future of compliance analytics.




This role would be especially well suited for a candidate who wants to pursue a graduate degree in a quantitative social science field.




What you’ll do

Draw inferences about behavior and organizational culture using various data techniques
Independently manage a diverse range of datasets, including conducting preliminary and exploratory analysis, merging datasets, and creating clear documentation.
Develop and present clear, concise visualizations to showcase findings
Communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders, including C-Suite leaders, through memos and presentations.
Collaborate on innovative R&D projects to shape the future of compliance and organizational culture analytics




What we’re looking for from you

An exceptional academic record with a bachelor's in Economics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
2-4 years of experience in quantitative data analysis, preferably within a consulting or tech environment.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and modeling.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings clearly and concisely.
Self-starter comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.




Some nice to-haves

Knowledge of Stata is highly desirable.
Experience in consulting, particularly in projects related to organizational culture or compliance.




What we offer

Competitive compensation package
A collaborative environment with a kind, dedicated, friendly team
The opportunity to engage in meaningful work that tackles significant integrity challenges facing organizations today
Opportunities for professional development, training, and career progression.
Paid time off
Health, vision, and dental insurance
401k plan




We value diverse viewpoints, and we do not discriminate based on one’s race, creed, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, handicap, disability, veteran status, or military obligations.

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance - REMOTE
Description:
Put your Insurance Experience to work - FROM HOME!

At WAHVE we value significant insurance experience and want to revolutionize the way people think about phasing into retirement by offering qualified candidates the opportunity to continue their career working from home. As we say - retire from the office but not from work. Our unique platform provides you with real work/life balance and allows you to customize your own work schedule while continuing to utilize your insurance expertise in a remote, long-term position which includes company benefits!

What You’ll Love About Wahve

We created a welcoming place to work with friendly and professional leadership. We are known for the great care we take with our staff and our clients. We are passionate and determined about delivering the best customer service, preserving insurance industry knowledge, and making a difference by the work that we do.

What We Are Seeking

We have assignments available to help our insurance industry clients in Data Analyst positions. Responsibilities include:


Build and maintain data warehouse, new reports, and ad hoc reports.
Work with user groups to identify reporting issues/enhancements and document business requirements.
Will serve as a member of a project team and/or work independently on projects.
Support and train internal users as needed.
Compile and prepare data for customer analysis.
Experience in C#, Visual Studio, JavaScript, CSS, and current web technologies such as .NET, ASP, JSON, and XML.
Experience with ANY of the following technologies: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SSIS Reporting, Power BI, Dynamics CRM, Dynamics GP, Share point, Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot.
Ability to compile data results and author commentary on industry studies is a plus.
Insurance or financial services industry experience required. Current high demand for property CAT and AIR Catastrophe modeling skills.


TO BECOME A WORK-AT-HOME VINTAGE EXPERT, WE REQUIRE


25 years of full-time work experience
Experience working in a data analysis role in the insurance or financial services industry - required


Benefits Of Becoming a Wahve Vintage Expert


Health insurance based on eligibility.
401(k) with a 4% match.
Retire from the office but not from work.
Eliminate the office stress and the commute.
Choose the work you would like to do now.
Customize your schedule - full or part time.
Utilize your years of insurance industry knowledge.
Be part of our dynamic yet virtual team environment and connect with other experienced insurance professionals like yourself!


How To Get Started

HTML:
Put your Insurance Experience to work - FROM HOME!

At WAHVE we value significant insurance experience and want to revolutionize the way people think about phasing into retirement by offering qualified candidates the opportunity to continue their career working from home. As we say - retire from the office but not from work. Our unique platform provides you with real work/life balance and allows you to customize your own work schedule while continuing to utilize your insurance expertise in a remote, long-term position which includes company benefits!

What You’ll Love About Wahve

We created a welcoming place to work with friendly and professional leadership. We are known for the great care we take with our staff and our clients. We are passionate and determined about delivering the best customer service, preserving insurance industry knowledge, and making a difference by the work that we do.

What We Are Seeking

We have assignments available to help our insurance industry clients in Data Analyst positions. Responsibilities include:

  • Build and maintain data warehouse, new reports, and ad hoc reports.
  • Work with user groups to identify reporting issues/enhancements and document business requirements.
  • Will serve as a member of a project team and/or work independently on projects.
  • Support and train internal users as needed.
  • Compile and prepare data for customer analysis.
  • Experience in C#, Visual Studio, JavaScript, CSS, and current web technologies such as .NET, ASP, JSON, and XML.
  • Experience with ANY of the following technologies: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SSIS Reporting, Power BI, Dynamics CRM, Dynamics GP, Share point, Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot.
  • Ability to compile data results and author commentary on industry studies is a plus.
  • Insurance or financial services industry experience required. Current high demand for property CAT and AIR Catastrophe modeling skills.

TO BECOME A WORK-AT-HOME VINTAGE EXPERT, WE REQUIRE

  • 25 years of full-time work experience
  • Experience working in a data analysis role in the insurance or financial services industry - required

Benefits Of Becoming a Wahve Vintage Expert

  • Health insurance based on eligibility.
  • 401(k) with a 4% match.
  • Retire from the office but not from work.
  • Eliminate the office stress and the commute.
  • Choose the work you would like to do now.
  • Customize your schedule - full or part time.
  • Utilize your years of insurance industry knowledge.
  • Be part of our dynamic yet virtual team environment and connect with other experienced insurance professionals like yourself!

How To Get Started

Click APPLY NOW to complete our simple preliminary profile. Be sure to include your preferred contact information as one of our Qualification Specialists will connect with you promptly.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Title: Tableau Specialist
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Job Description

Tableau Specialist, Data Analysis

Location: Waltham, MA (hybrid)

Get To Know The Team:

SS&C Intralinks is seeking a talented and motivated Sr. Business Operations Analyst to join our Product Development team. You will report to the Senior Director of Product Development Operations and work cross-functionally with our Product, FP&A, Sales Operations and Change Management teams to help deliver actionable insights to our product management and senior leadership teams.

Why You Will Love It Here!


Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model & Business Casual Dress Code
Your Future: 401k Matching Program, Professional Development Reimbursement
Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays
Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave
Diversity & Inclusion: Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity
Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, including SS&C University
Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more!


What You Will Get To Do:


Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau and other BI solutions
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and provide actionable recommendations based on findings
Develop ROI model for new product initiatives
Help develop and maintain data dictionary and other documentation for data models, processes, and reporting standards to ensure knowledge sharing and consistency
Serve as a subject matter expert for all cross functional stakeholders needing timely and relevant data for their analyses
Monitor data quality and resolve any discrepancies or inconsistencies in collaboration with data engineering teams


What You Will Bring:


Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience required
3-5 years of experience as a BI Analyst or Business Operations Manager, with a track record of designing and delivering impactful reporting solutions
Experience working in a SaaS business
Expert level in using Tableau to create dashboards and visualizations
Expert level Excel and SQL skills for data querying and manipulation
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and data modeling principles
Strong data optimization skills and experience working with large data sets
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality


Thank you for your interest in SS&C! To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at www.ssctech.com/careers.

Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst in Boston $65,000
Description:
Marketing Data Analyst in Boston! $65,000 +

Company Overview

Join us at ProPivotal, where data meets dynamism, and your career aspirations thrive! With a prestigious 28-year legacy, we have established ourselves as the premier choice for staffing solutions among mid-size organizations in the Boston area.

We provide temporary staffing, direct-hire staffing, managed staffing, and recruitment process outsourcing staffing. As a recognized leader in the staffing industry, ProPivotal is not just a workplace – it's a pathway to professional excellence.

Why Work at ProPivotal

At ProPivotal, we're pioneers of talent solutions! Our secret sauce? Deep-rooted relationships and tailor-made services that keep our clients coming back for more.

Team Spirit: Say goodbye to the isolation of remote work! At ProPivotal, you'll find yourself surrounded by a team that's not just colleagues but companions in your professional journey. Together, we celebrate victories, overcome challenges, and forge bonds that last a lifetime.

Transparent Leadership: Our management team isn't just at the helm; they're alongside you, guiding, supporting, and empowering you every step of the way. Experience the transparency, integrity, and dedication of ProPivotal's leadership firsthand.

Unparalleled Training: At ProPivotal, learning never stops. We offer personalized support and invest in your growth. Get ready to earn your stripes with the Certified Staffing Professional Certificate from the American Staffing Association, backed by ProPivotal's unwavering support.

15 Years of Excellence: ProPivotal's commitment to excellence is not just a promise; it's a legacy. With 15 consecutive years of winning the Best of Staffing industry award, we set the benchmark for excellence in the staffing realm.

Marketing Data Analyst Responsibilities

As a Marketing Data Analyst at ProPivotal, you'll be at the forefront of our data-driven revolution. Dive deep into candidate applications, harness the power of data analytics, and unlock the full potential of candidate leads. Your responsibilities will include:


Interpreting data to optimize candidate utilization.
Crafting search parameters to match candidates with client job openings.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to address business needs.
Delivering insightful reports and presentations to senior management.


Who We're Looking For


Experience: Bring at least 3 years of related experience in a corporate environment to the table, with exposure to talent acquisition being a definite plus.
Analytical Acumen: Demonstrate a keen interest in analysis, with familiarity in tools like R or Python considered advantageous.
Critical Thinking: Possess superior critical thinking and analytical skills, coupled with an impeccable attention to detail.
Location:. Do you want to work in person in our Boston office. Our approach (100% in-office) is an important facilitator of staff development. We typically employ professionals who have an easy commute to our Boston Office (located near South Station).
Team Player: Enjoy and contribute to a positive team environment. We want someone who gets along with a variety of people/personalities and someone who can positively impact the work environment of peers, direct reports, leadership, and all employees. In plain English, someone who is free of drama and a pleasure to work with in good times and bad.


Join ProPivotal: We celebrate uniqueness and welcome everyone to the table, ProPivotal is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, color, religion, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor. #pando3-2

Title: Survey Analyst/Data Entry
Description:
ERG is a research and consulting firm that provides a wide range of support to federal, state, and commercial clients. ERG offers multidisciplinary teams with nationally recognized skills in engineering, science, economics, public health, informational technology, and communications. We hire people with the best minds and then provide them with a vibrant and flexible environment in which to develop their careers. The qualified individual must be highly motivated with the skills to prioritize, perform, and communicate effectively in a fast-paced environment. 




Eastern Research Group, Inc. (ERG) is seeking survey analysts to join our team in providing a range of services related to survey data collection and verification. The work will primarily be for the Department of Labor (DOL), Wage and Hour Division (WHD). DOL WHD directs and coordinates the determination of prevailing wage rates under the Davis-Bacon Act. Survey analysts will help collect, review, and validate data submitted in response to the wage rate data gathering efforts targeted at the construction industry. The work will involve data entry, cleaning, and verification, answering a telephone/email helpline, and performing quality control/quality assurance activities. 




Job Description:
Members of the team collecting, reviewing, and validating data in response to the wage rate data-gathering efforts targeted at the construction industry
Data entry, cleaning, and verification
Answer a telephone/email helpline to assist survey respondents
Perform quality control/quality assurance activities
Participate in additional projects for the Davis-Bacon Act as requested





Qualifications and Skills:
At least an associate degree
Self-motivated
Detail-oriented
Ability to familiarize with numerous protocols and think critically about when/how to apply them
Data cleaning experience, customer service, and familiarity with Microsoft Excel is desirable
Ability to obtain low-level security clearance








ERG offers competitive salaries and excellent benefits, including health and dental insurance, life insurance, long-term disability, educational benefits, FSAs, a generous 401k plan, profit sharing, an EAP, 11-20 paid vacation days per year, 10 paid holidays per year, 56 hours or more of sick leave (based on the state you work in) per year (pro-rated for part-time) and more. The salary range for all positions depends on the years and type of experience.

 

ERG is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable EEOC and affirmative action regulations. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. As such, successful candidates must be committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams.

  

Please be aware, the only authentic corporate domain for ERG is https://www.erg.com.  ERG may, on occasion, screen applicants via telephone or video interviews via Skype, Teams, GoToMeeting, or another type of video platform. However, any candidate extended a job offer might be asked to meet in person with an ERG employee before providing confidential personal information associated with new employment.

 

If you’re a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ERG’s online application process as a result of your disability. To request accommodation, please contact Human Resources via email at Resumes-Lex@erg.com or call (781) 674-7293.

 

As ERG is a friendly, flexible, inclusive environment and has clients who are committed to making the world a better place, ERGers are incredibly dedicated. We promote and recognize principles of fairness, equity, and social justice in the work we do, the partnerships we foster, and the culture we value both within and outside of our organization.
